attributes.title: Atari SUED for Stiffing Developers on Royalties
attributes.caption: Jan 3, 2017
attributes.description: It's a whole new year and that means more industry infighting. To kick it off right, the developers of Rollercoaster Tycoon and Planet Coaster are suing Atari for allegedly withholding millions of dollars in royalties from the developer.
attributes.display_title: Atari SUED for Stiffing Developers on Royalties

attributes.title: Pokemon Stars! Launch Games! Nintendo Switch Event LEAKS
attributes.caption: Jan 4, 2017
attributes.description: The Nintendo Switch gets its full debut next week, but it just wouldn't be right to let them have their surprises. That's why there are leaks! The newest details include updates on Switch's battery life, launch game lineup, pricing, and release date.
attributes.display_title: Pokemon Stars! Launch Games! Nintendo Switch Event LEAKS

attributes.title: Bloodborne 2 (or Dark Souls 4) COMING THIS YEAR?
attributes.caption: Jan 4, 2017
attributes.description: From Software's been teasing their upcoming projects, and if you're in the mood to hate yourself and break controllers, good news! Bloodborne 2 (or, longer shot, maybe Dark Souls 4) looks to be coming this year. And maybe a new Armored Core if we've all been very good.
attributes.display_title: Bloodborne 2 (or Dark Souls 4) COMING THIS YEAR?

attributes.title: Xbox One & PS4: 2016 Results + 2017 Exclusives
attributes.caption: Jan 5, 2017
attributes.description: 2016 is dead. Long live 2017. Since the year's finished, Microsoft and Sony have released numbers for how their consoles fared in the year, and shared details about how they plan to make 2017 bigger than ever.

attributes.title: THE YEAR OF THE INDIE GAME? State of the Gaming Industry
attributes.caption: Jan 6, 2017
attributes.description: We've got full year numbers for how various gaming platforms performed, and there are some surprising upsets. Based on Steam analytics, indie games like Stardew Valley made more money in 2016 than AAA franchises like Call of Duty. Let's break down how different genres and platforms did throughout the year, and what it means for the industry.
attributes.display_title: THE YEAR OF THE INDIE GAME? State of the Gaming Industry

attributes.title: FIRST ALIEN CONTACT! Thargoids Discovered in Elite Dangerous
attributes.caption: Jan 6, 2017
attributes.description: We've discovered aliens! In a videogame, anyway. After years of teases by the developers, gamers have finally come face to face with the alien race of Thargoids in Elite Dangerous. Potentially more impressive than the years of teases actually paying off is that the developers managed to keep the secret of the race from data miners until the big reveal.
attributes.display_title: FIRST ALIEN CONTACT! Thargoids Discovered in Elite Dangerous

attributes.title: Half-life 3 the RTS (or FMV game)? What Might Have Been
attributes.caption: Jan 9, 2017
attributes.description: New news about Half-Life 3! No, it's not coming out. But we have an idea what might have been... and it might have been an RTS game... or a live action FMV game. Weird.
attributes.display_title: Half-life 3 the RTS (or FMV game)? What Might Have Been

attributes.title: Scalebound CANCELLED!
attributes.caption: Jan 9, 2017
attributes.description: Scalebound, the dragon-based action RPG from Platinum Games slated for Xbox One and PC... has been cancelled. Microsoft made the announcement earlier today after reports began to leak and gamers noticed that its page was missing from the Xbox Store. This is just the latest cancellation by Microsoft in a series of unfortunate events that's resulted in a thin lineup of exclusives for the platform. And reportedly, it's not the only game suffering.

attributes.title: Nier's Butthole Controversy a HOAX?
attributes.caption: Jan 10, 2017
attributes.description: It's only January but we've got a frontrunner for most ridiculous story of the year. NieR Automata's community has been in an uproar over an upskirt image that revealed the character's butthole. Yes, this is news. Fan artists have had heart attacks (probably, figuratively speaking), the creator has responded, and the whole thing's not even real. It's hard to know where to start, but we're on the case.

attributes.title: WARNING: Major Leak for HORIZON: ZERO DAWN
attributes.caption: Jan 10, 2017
attributes.description: Looking forward to Horizon: Zero Dawn? Be careful on the internet. It's sprung a major leak with cool details like world size and gameplay, but also dangerous details like the entire ending. We're not going to discuss all of it, but let's definitely talk about some of the non-story-specific details.
attributes.display_title: WARNING: Major Leak for HORIZON: ZERO DAWN

attributes.title: NEW 15 Launch Games? Date! Price! Everything We Know About Nintendo Switch
attributes.caption: Jan 11, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo will unleash all the details you can handle about the Nintendo Switch tomorrow night, but we haven't been idly waiting for it. Here's everything we know (and think we know) about the new console, plus some new details about release date, price, and launch games.
attributes.display_title: NEW 15 Launch Games? Date! Price! Everything We Know About Nintendo Switch

attributes.title: GAMES ARE GETTING WORSE? not so fast...
attributes.caption: Jan 11, 2017
attributes.description: A new study shows that fewer games than ever are receiving top marks with game reviewers (yes, in spite of all those "they were paid to say good things" memes). Does that mean games are getting worse? Or maybe there's something else going on...
attributes.display_title: GAMES ARE GETTING WORSE? not so fast...

attributes.title: NINTENDO SWITCH: PRICE! DATE! GAMES! HARDWARE! What You Need to Know
attributes.caption: Jan 13, 2017
attributes.description: Sure, you could watch an hour of a Japanese livestream translated to English by extremely disinterested translators. OR... you can get all the information in less time, right here! We've got everything you need to know about Nintendo Switch right here--price, release date, accessories, hardware, launch games, and colors.
attributes.display_title: NINTENDO SWITCH: PRICE! DATE! GAMES! HARDWARE! What You Need to Know

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch: WHAT'S MISSING
attributes.caption: Jan 17, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch announced all the things it DOES have last week, but since the press conference it turns out there are a lot of things it DOESN'T have... voice chat is just the beginning.

attributes.title: New PORTAL/HALF-LIFE Universe Games! Valve's Future! Gabe Newell SPEAKS
attributes.caption: Jan 18, 2017
attributes.description: Gabe Newell, known to the PC gamers who worship him as GabeN, has descended from his home in the heavens (aka probably Valve in Seattle) to speak. The angel spreading his words? Reddit, obviously. In an AMA the godfather of PC gaming speaks about the future of games in the Half-life and Portal universe, movies, Left 4 Dead, and so much more. But mostly about the future of games i the Half-life and Portal universe.
attributes.display_title: New PORTAL/HALF-LIFE Universe Games! Valve's Future! Gabe Newell SPEAKS

attributes.title: Indie Devs Gone Wild with Reviews
attributes.caption: Jan 18, 2017
attributes.description: Picture this. You've just made a game. You put it out in the world, and you want it to do well. But unlike those other lazy publishers or developers, you decide to go the extra mile. You're going to make everyone think this game is GOTY material, even if you have to fake the reviews or threaten reviewers. What could go wrong?
attributes.display_title: Indie Devs Gone Wild with Reviews

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch: Smartphone App REQUIRED for Online? - The Know Game News
attributes.caption: Nintendo talks about the Switch's online chat features which may REQUIRE the Smartphone App.
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch isn't a traditional gaming console. It doesn't play by the rules. But are all rules REALLY made to be broken? For example, is handling matchmaking and voice chat through a smartphone app ACTUALLY an elegant solution or is it kind of... weird?
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch: Smartphone App REQUIRED for Online? - The Know Game News

attributes.title: 128 Million Console Gamers MISSING?
attributes.caption: Jan 20, 2017
attributes.description: Projections for this new console generation show that we could be looking at 128 FEWER consoles sold. Where did those millions of console players go?

attributes.title: PlayStation VR: THE NEXT KINECT?
attributes.caption: Jan 20, 2017
attributes.description: PlayStation VR showed so much promise. The right backing. The right lineup. The right hardware. So why is Sony running silent on it?

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... Resident Evil VII
attributes.caption: Jan 21, 2017
attributes.description: Resident Evil VII hits shelves this week and aims to take the series back to its roots. Curious what the game is all about? Here's what you need to know.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go... Resident Evil VII

attributes.title: Resident Evil VII: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.caption: Jan 23, 2017
attributes.description: Resident Evil VII is almost here. Or, depending on when you watch this, it's already here! Reviews are out and good news for those hoping the game delivers on the promise of being terrifying and creepy and a return to Resident Evil's roots.
attributes.display_title: Resident Evil VII: IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 GUNS DOWN GTA Online?
attributes.caption: Jan 24, 2017
attributes.description: A leaker suggests we've seen the last big hurrah for GTA Online, as Rockstar prepares to switch gears entirely to Red Dead later this year.
attributes.display_title: Red Dead Redemption 2 GUNS DOWN GTA Online?

attributes.title: Xbox Scorpio NOT NATIVE 4K?
attributes.caption: Jan 24, 2017
attributes.description: A newly leaked set of Microsoft white papers for Xbox Scorpio reveal new details about the upcoming console, like... it may not be pushing true 4K for every game after all?

attributes.title: Video Games Headed for a PRICE HIKE?
attributes.caption: Jan 25, 2017
attributes.description: Incoming US governmental policies may lead to an increase in the cost of games. As the government takes aim at tariffs for importing goods created outside the US, everything from video games to consoles could see a price hike of as much as 10%.
attributes.display_title: Video Games Headed for a PRICE HIKE?

attributes.title: SURPRISE Pokemon Duel Release! ...Instead of Pokemon Stars on Switch?
attributes.caption: Jan 25, 2017
attributes.description: The Pokemon Company unexpectedly dropped a new mobile game, Pokemon Duel, outside Japan. However, word is it might also come to Nintendo Switch, which might also mean that there is no Pokemon Stars after all...
attributes.display_title: SURPRISE Pokemon Duel Release! ...Instead of Pokemon Stars on Switch?

attributes.title: Square-Enix and Marvel TEAM UP for The Avengers Games
attributes.caption: Jan 26, 2017
attributes.description: Is Avengers the next Final Fantasy? Will it be 10+ years between entries like Kingdom Hearts? Will all the Avengers get cool cybernetic parts like Deus Ex? Something something Tomb Raider? Disney must like working with Square-Enix because Marvel's teaming up with the gaming company to produce The Avengers-themed videogames that hopefully don't suck like previous attempts.
attributes.display_title: Square-Enix and Marvel TEAM UP for The Avengers Games

attributes.title: Xbox One DRAGGING MICROSOFT DOWN! ...or is it?
attributes.caption: Jan 27, 2017
attributes.description: The Xbox One business is down year over year, contributing to a dip in Microsoft's games business. But it's not all bad, because games and Xbox Live are up! So... where's all that doom? Bueller? Bueller?
attributes.display_title: Xbox One DRAGGING MICROSOFT DOWN! ...or is it?

attributes.title: NEW Nintendo Switch Hardware Specs & Games!
attributes.caption: Jan 27, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo has released more detailed specs about what's under the hood of Nintendo Switch! Combine that with more games announced for console launch and you've got yourself some news!
attributes.display_title: NEW Nintendo Switch Hardware Specs & Games!

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... FIRE EMBLEM HEROES
attributes.caption: Jan 28, 2017
attributes.description: Fire Emblem Heroes was given a surprise release date and it's almost here. Curious how the popular tactical RPG will translate to mobile? Here's everything you need to know.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go... FIRE EMBLEM HEROES

attributes.title: Deus Ex CANCELED?
attributes.caption: January 30, 2017
attributes.description: Looks like not enough people asked for this -- Deus Ex might be on an indefinite hiatus, thanks to lackluster sales and Square Enix's new deal to make Marvel games.

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 SUPER BOWL TRAILER & Release Date? - The Know Gaming News
attributes.caption: January 30, 2017
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 could make its next appearance on... Super Bowl Sunday? Rumors are pointing to a new trailer AND a release date for this weekend. See, sportsballs aren't so bad.
attributes.display_title: Red Dead Redemption 2 SUPER BOWL TRAILER & Release Date? - The Know Gaming News

attributes.title: Fallout New Vegas 2 COMING SOON?
attributes.caption: The internet's buzzing with rumors of Fallout New Vegas 2 this morning. According to one source, it's being developed by Obsidian and will be revealed at E3 this year -- but is it too early to get our hopes up?

attributes.title: Is Final Fantasy 7 Remake VAPORWARE?
attributes.description: Guys, it's time to have The Talk. Final Fantasy 7 Remake might just be a pipe dream. At least it certainly seems that way, given some new comments from the game's developers about their progress -- or lack of it -- since the last time we saw the game.

attributes.title: New Bioware IP SOON! Battlefront 2 Campaign Details!
attributes.description: EA gave us a ton of new information about the upcoming year in their most recent earnings call, including the release of Bioware's next IP, and the fact that Star Wars Battlefront 2 will span multiple eras of the Star Wars universe. Plus, some conservative projections about Mass Effect Andromeda.
attributes.display_title: New Bioware IP SOON! Battlefront 2 Campaign Details!

attributes.title: GameStop Wants Employees to LIE?
attributes.description: GameStop's got a controversial new "Circle of Life" program that, sadly, has nothing to do with Lion King. Instead, it's a new way of doing business that doesn't sound all that great for customers or employees. That's what you get for besmirching Lion King, guys.

attributes.title: NeoGAF MELTDOWN
attributes.caption: Oct 23, 2017
attributes.description: NeoGAF, one of gaming's longest-running forums, hit kind of a... snafu over the weekend. The site went down for several days and lost many of its moderators over sexual misconduct allegations against its owner. The site is juuuuust coming back online, but many are wondering if it's ever going to be the same after its mass exodus this weekend?

attributes.title: G2A Reddit AMA BACKFIRES
attributes.description: Buying cheap Steam keys sounds like a pretty nice deal... at least until you accidentally buy a stolen one. Steam key reseller G2A has been criticized quite a bit for this, so they decided to host an AMA to clear the air... which turned into a total disaster. Seriously, it's hard to look away.

attributes.title: Devs Forget DRM, Pirates Release FREE
attributes.description: Oops. Conan Exile hit Steam early access this week, and developers Funcom accidentally left out one important thing -- DRM. Conan Exiles was supposed to ship with Denuvo protection, but now it and all of its floppy dongs are out in the wild, thanks to pirates.
attributes.display_title: Devs Forget DRM, Pirates Release FREE

attributes.title: Immigration Ban HURTING Games Industry?
attributes.description: The U.S.'s new immigration policies are having an effect on the games industry. This week, multiple game developers and industry leaders have come out against the recent immigration bans, saying it limits the video game industry's pool of talent.

attributes.title: Overwatch Boss: Keyboard and Mouse CHEATING!
attributes.description: People always love to argue about whether or not keyboard and mouse beats a controller, but now Overwatch's Jeff Kaplan has said he thinks keyboard and mouse should be banned from console play altogether. Get those flame suits on.
attributes.display_title: Overwatch Boss: Keyboard and Mouse CHEATING!

attributes.title: EA Mobile Game Costs THOUSANDS!
attributes.description: Whatever happened to the good old days, when "free to play" literally meant you could play a game for free. That's certainly not the case with Star Wars Galaxy of Heroes, which can cost you thousands in microtransactions to fully power up your characters.

attributes.title: Switch: Weakest Launch EVER? By the Numbers!
attributes.description: Lots of people are saying the Switch has a weak launch lineup, but now some of the numbers might actually back that up. One site released a study of launch lineups for the last 23 years... and the outlook isn't really in Nintendo's favor.
attributes.display_title: Switch: Weakest Launch EVER? By the Numbers!

attributes.title: YouTubers FOUND GUILTY For Gambling
attributes.description: YouTube and video game gambling have been all the rage lately, and now two YouTubers have just been found guilty of illegal gambling by a British court. No, it's not TMartn and ProSyndicate, but it's got a lot of people wondering if they'll be next.

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 FIRST DETAILS
attributes.description: OK, so we didn't get a Super Bowl trailer for Red Dead Redemption 2, but we got the 32nd best alternative... investor calls! Rockstar parent company Take Two dished out the first morsels of anything related to Red Dead Redemption 2 this week, and even talked about whether or not it will kill GTA Online.

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda DITCHING Paragon/Renegade!
attributes.description: We've got some breaking news that Mass Effect Andromeda won't be including one of the series staples... because Paragon and Renegade options will be gone from the next game. What's next, they'll ditch the SPACESHIPS, too?

attributes.title: Call of Duty REBOOTED! Destiny 2 First Details!
attributes.description: Looks like all those dislikes really got to Activision. They've finally acknowledged the Infinite Warfare colored elephant in the room and said they'll be taking the series back to its roots. Plus, Destiny 2 gets some of its first details... and Bungie's
attributes.display_title: Call of Duty REBOOTED! Destiny 2 First Details!

attributes.title: Every Game NOT Coming to Nintendo Switch
attributes.description: Nintendo's new system is only a few weeks away... and at this point we might know more about the games NOT coming to the system than the games that are actually coming out. We round up both for you so you know what you will and won't be playing.
attributes.display_title: Every Game NOT Coming to Nintendo Switch

attributes.title: Know Before You Go...  For Honor
attributes.description: For Honor brings its unique brand of hack and slash multiplayer to the masses. What's the game all about? Here's everything you need to know.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go...  For Honor

attributes.title: Paid Mods RETURNING? + Valve Kills Steam Greenlight!
attributes.caption: Feb 13, 2017
attributes.description: Big changes are coming to Steam. Over the weekend, we got word that Valve not only wants to replace the Steam Greenlight program, but they're also thinking about dabbling in the dark arts of paid mods all over again. Didn't they learn their lesson the first time?
attributes.display_title: Paid Mods RETURNING? + Valve Kills Steam Greenlight!

attributes.title: Halo Wars 2: Is It Good?
attributes.caption: Feb 16, 2017
attributes.description: Reviews are hitting for Halo Wars 2. Want to know the highs and lows before you drop your money on it? We've got you covered.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Sent Out EARLY + Zelda Gameplay Details
attributes.caption: Feb 17, 2017
attributes.description: A Nintendo Switch was sent out early to a fan, who gave us the world's first unboxing video and look at the system. Plus, Zelda gameplay has leaked, showing off the early minutes of the game and more bits of gameplay, so... be wary of spoilers!
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch Sent Out EARLY + Zelda Gameplay Details

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... HALO WARS 2
attributes.caption: Feb 19, 2017
attributes.description: Ok, so Halo Wars 2 is partially out if you splurged on the ultimate edition, but for everyone else it comes out on Tuesday! Here's everything you need to know about the game when deciding if it's right for you.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go... HALO WARS 2

attributes.title: Horizon Zero Dawn: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.caption: Feb 21,2017
attributes.description: Horizon: Zero Dawn is nearly here so we'll all be able to shoot bows and arrows at giant intelligent robots. Reviews are hitting hard and fast, and there are enough to answer the big question: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.display_title: Horizon Zero Dawn: IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda: Hands-on Impressions & New Details Emerge!
attributes.caption: Feb 23, 2017
attributes.description: Bioware has finally given critics hands-on time with Mass Effect Andromeda, taking them through the game's opening mission, plus some mid-game gameplay. Preview impressions are rolling in now and offering a bunch of new details about what you can expect when the game hits shelves next month!
attributes.display_title: Mass Effect Andromeda: Hands-on Impressions & New Details Emerge!

attributes.title: The REAL COST of Nintendo Switch?
attributes.caption: Feb 23, 2017
attributes.description: We've known the official price for Nintendo Switch for a while now, but since we've spent some hands-on time we have a better idea which accessories you'll need to shell out for to use the console to its full potential. OPEN YOUR WALLETS! WE'RE GOING IN!
attributes.display_title: The REAL COST of Nintendo Switch?

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Has a HARDWARE PROBLEM?
attributes.caption: Feb 25, 2017
attributes.description: Now that critic has their hands on Nintendo Switch, some are reporting a hardware issue with the left joy-con desyncing. How serious is it? Let's have a look.UPDATE: It appears the desync issue is specifically related to water (and fleshbags made mostly of water) hindering the signal from the joy-con to the TV. Still an issue, but if you work around it by being careful, you can.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch Has a HARDWARE PROBLEM?

attributes.title: BATMAN: ARKHAM INSURGENCY Leaked?! slow down there
attributes.caption: Feb 24, 2017
attributes.description: A firehose-sized leak has erupted, with tons of details about an unannounced Batman Arkham game called Insurgency. The leak makes some compelling points, but slow down before you go all in on this one. There are plenty of reasons to be skeptical.
attributes.display_title: BATMAN: ARKHAM INSURGENCY Leaked?! slow down there

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... HORIZON: ZERO DAWN

attributes.description: Horizon: Zero Dawn is the ambitious new title from Guerrilla Games, and it launches on PS4 this week. Curious to know how giant robots mix with bow and arrow? Here's everything you need to know.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go... HORIZON: ZERO DAWN

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch BATTERY LIFE TESTED (and how to get the most out of it)!
attributes.caption: Feb 27, 2017
attributes.description: One of the biggest worries about Nintendo Switch is whether the battery life will last long enough for proper play sessions. We give it a thorough test to see how long Zelda can last, how long it takes to charge, and how you can extend its life while you're on the go.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch BATTERY LIFE TESTED (and how to get the most out of it)!

attributes.title: Console Makers FIGHTING Repair Laws
attributes.caption: Feb 27, 2017
attributes.description: Lawmakers are introducing legislation that would require hardware manufacturers to not only ALLOW self-repair of electronics, but to provide hardware and manuals. And console manufacturers are fighting it tooth and nail.

attributes.title: Xbox Game Pass Destroys USED GAMES? New Subscription Service!
attributes.caption: Feb 28, 2017
attributes.description: Microsoft is taking on the used games business and trying to convince gamers that Xbox One is worth the investment! How? By launching their own Netflix-style subscription service offering 100+ games for $10 per month!
attributes.display_title: Xbox Game Pass Destroys USED GAMES? New Subscription Service!

attributes.title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild ALREADY PIRATED!
attributes.caption: Feb 28, 2017
attributes.description: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild comes out this week, but pirates have it way ahead of its release, thanks to broken street dates and sneaky game crackers.
attributes.display_title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild ALREADY PIRATED!

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch: BUY? WAIT? SKIP? OUR VERDICTS (Couch Chat)
attributes.caption: Mar 1, 2017
attributes.description: No, this isn't The Patch, but we wanted to talk anyway.Nintendo Switch arrives on Friday. Since Nintendo sent The Know an early console to test, we've had a week to put the hardware through its paces and see if we like what it has to offer.

attributes.title: GameStop CRASHING Over Subscriptions?
attributes.caption: Mar 1, 2017
attributes.description: GameStop's stock is crashing in the wake of Xbox's Game Pass announcement, with investors worried that the growth of subscription services will hit the brick-and-mortar retailer where it counts: in their used game sales.

attributes.title: Star Wars BATTLEFRONT 2 Adding Ultimate Team Microtransactions?
attributes.caption: Mar 2, 2017
attributes.description: Let's be real. FIFA Ultimate Team micro-transactions make a LOT of money for EA. So now they want to add their money-making machine to titles like Battlefield and even Star Wars: Battlefront.
attributes.display_title: Star Wars BATTLEFRONT 2 Adding Ultimate Team Microtransactions?

attributes.title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild is the BEST GAME EVER?
attributes.caption: Mar 2, 2017
attributes.description: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is Nintendo Switch's pillar launch title. It's also in the running for one of the best games of all time. Period. That's it. That's what the reviews say.
attributes.display_title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild is the BEST GAME EVER?

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.caption: Mar 3, 2017
attributes.description: You've heard what WE have to say (hopefully), but let's see what professional critics think of the Nintendo Switch hardware as they answer the question... IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Launch: SUCCESS OR FAILURE?
attributes.caption: Mar 6, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch is officially out and we're starting to get sales numbers... and reports of hardware problems. Let's check out the best and worst of the system's launch.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch Launch: SUCCESS OR FAILURE?

attributes.title: Ghost Recon Wildlands: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.caption: Mar 6, 2017
attributes.description: Ghost Recon: Wildlands is here tomorrow. Reviews are trickling in, so we can finally answer the biggest question: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.display_title: Ghost Recon Wildlands: IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch MOST SUCCESSFUL LAUNCH EVER for Nintendo?
attributes.caption: Mar 7, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch hasn't even been out a week, but numbers coming in look pretty promising for Nintendo's new hybrid console. It's on track to leave Wii U in the dust, thankfully, and is even outperforming Wii launch numbers in most regions.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch MOST SUCCESSFUL LAUNCH EVER for Nintendo?

attributes.title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild Accused of PAID REVIEWS and Brigaded
attributes.caption: Mar 7, 2017
attributes.description: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild has received unprecedented acclaim from video game critics, with an aggregate score that puts it as one of the best games ever made. Gamers who disagree are now brigading review sites like Metacritic with accusations that the reviews are paid for by Nintendo.
attributes.display_title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild Accused of PAID REVIEWS and Brigaded

attributes.title: Modern Warfare Remastered RIP-OFF!
attributes.caption: Mar 8, 2017
attributes.description: Last year Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare bolstered its sales by making itself a required purchase to access Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered. Now Activision is doubling down by charging fans of the popular game MORE for additional content than it cost in the original game.

attributes.title: SUPER TRADEMARK TROLLS! Candy Crush Dev Strikes Again
attributes.caption: Mar 8, 2017
attributes.description: Well this is just, uh... a word no one can use anymore. The makers of Candy Crush Saga, who have famously pursued trademarks for the words Candy and Saga in the past, are stepping it up once again by registering a trademark for the word SUPER in video games. This is going to end well.
attributes.display_title: SUPER TRADEMARK TROLLS! Candy Crush Dev Strikes Again

attributes.title: No Man's Sky HUGE UPDATE! Does it Deliver?
attributes.caption: Mar 9, 2017
attributes.description: Another huge update is out for No Man's Sky, adding new modes and new features. This is the second major update for the game since its launch, and indicates that the developers are still working and adding promised features.
attributes.display_title: No Man's Sky HUGE UPDATE! Does it Deliver?

attributes.title: Conan Exiles CENSORED on Console!
attributes.caption: Mar 9, 2017
attributes.description: Conan Exiles is known for, well... dong sliders. It's one of the features that set the game apart when it released on PC via Steam Early Access. But the game's headed for consoles and now it's ditching the dongs in favor of family friendliness.

attributes.title: What killed the Sega Dreamcast?
attributes.caption: The Sega Dreamcast is considered by many to be one of the most advanced consoles of its time. Plus, it had a built-in modem and a kick-ass library of games. So why did it die?

attributes.title: What Amiibo do in Breath of the Wild!
attributes.caption: There are a ton of Amiibo out there and with the recent release of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild we take a look at what each Amiibo will get you!
attributes.display_title: What Amiibo do in Breath of the Wild!

attributes.title: Game Critic DDOSed By Zelda Fans
attributes.display_title: Game Critic DDOSed By Zelda Fans

attributes.title: Nintendo: There's Nothing Wrong with the Switch
attributes.caption: Nintendo Switch keeps getting hardware complaints, but how widespread are those issues in reality? Well if you ask Nintendo, they don't exist and it's all in your head.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo: There's Nothing Wrong with the Switch

attributes.title: Gamers vs THE APOCALYPSE
attributes.caption: Mar 14, 2017
attributes.description: There are a lot of movies predicting the end of the world: from Armageddon to This Is The End to Interstellar to Seeking a Friend for the End of the World. And they all predict how humans would handle it differently. To get a more accurate picture, scientists have turned to a new source for end-of-days simulation... MMOs.

attributes.title: Switch Sales Revealed! NINTENDO IS BACK?
attributes.caption: Mar 14, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has been highly anticipated and early buzz pointed to it doing well, but now data firms are weighing in with hardware sales numbers that indicate Nintendo is back in a big way... if they can keep the games coming.
attributes.display_title: Switch Sales Revealed! NINTENDO IS BACK?

attributes.title: Should You be WORRIED About Mass Effect: Andromeda?
attributes.caption: Mar 15, 2017
attributes.description: Reviews won't hit for a few days still, but early reports of Mass Effect: Andromeda are pretty polarizing. While some are happy with where the game is at, others have nothing good to say about Bioware's follow-up to the Mass Effect trilogy.
attributes.display_title: Should You be WORRIED About Mass Effect: Andromeda?

attributes.title: Where are the MOST WANTED Games for Nintendo Switch?
attributes.caption: Mar 15, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has launched strong with help from Zelda: Breath of the Wild, but now Switch owners are starting to finish it and look for more games. Let's take a look at some of the most wanted and rumored games for the platform and see where those are at, and how likely they are to make an appearance.
attributes.display_title: Where are the MOST WANTED Games for Nintendo Switch?

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda ALREADY A MEME
attributes.caption: Mar 16, 2017
attributes.description: The trickle of warning about Mass Effect Andromeda is becoming a roar now that the game is out on EA Access to offer a timed demo for subscribers. So much so that it's getting memed all over the place thanks to plastic humans, clunky animations, and a general inability to walk (which we still think could be caused by cryosleep... WE JUST WANT IT TO BE GOOD, OK?).
attributes.display_title: Mass Effect Andromeda ALREADY A MEME

attributes.title: Outlast 2 BANNED
attributes.caption: Mar 16, 2017
attributes.description: Australia, you've done it again. You added an R18+ rating to encompass the really mature games... and you're still banning the really mature games! This time it's Outlast 2's turn.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch DOUBLING Output!
attributes.caption: Mar 17, 2017
attributes.description: Breaking News: Nintendo Switch is selling pretty well. Better than expected, apparently, because Nintendo is doubling their output of hardware over the next year to try to meet demand.

attributes.title: For Honor's New Content RIP-OFF?
attributes.caption: Mar 17, 2017
attributes.description: For Honor has introduced some cheeky, fun, totally optional new cosmetic emotes for characters. Sounds good so far, right? Here's the catch: you can either shell out real money or plan on spending the next few years grinding to get them. That's pretty reminiscent of the Free to Play model except... For Honor costs $60!

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... MASS EFFECT ANDROMEDA
attributes.caption: Mar 18, 2017
attributes.description: Mass Effect Andromeda is the fourth game in the popular space-based action RPG series, Mass Effect. Andromeda is the first entry following the trilogy and stars new characters, a new galaxy, and a new story. Here's a quick summary of everything you need to know before you go.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go... MASS EFFECT ANDROMEDA

attributes.title: Why Do Games Cost $60?
attributes.caption: Mar 19, 2017
attributes.description: Games cost $60 and have for a long time. Why? And how does paid DLC fit into all this? Let's take a look at how the revenue from buying games splits out so you know where your money goes when you buy a game.

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda: DOES IT SUCK?
attributes.caption: Mar 20, 2017
attributes.description: Reviews are in for Mass Effect Andromeda, following early impressions over the last week that have revealed all kinds of glitches and bugs. Are the gameplay and story enough to counteract the rough edges or DOES IT SUCK?
attributes.display_title: Mass Effect Andromeda: DOES IT SUCK?

attributes.title: Pokémon for Nintendo Switch Listing!
attributes.caption: Mar 20, 2017
attributes.description: Rumors of Pok_Ï„Õ_µ„÷_Ï„_‰Û¡___Õ_µ„__Ï„Õ_µ__Ï___µå©mon for Nintendo Switch have been floating around for a while. New job postings for developer Game Freak reveal more, like when we might see the the game (or games)!

attributes.title: Xbox vs the SUPREME COURT
attributes.caption: Mar 22, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox has been fighting gamers in court for years now over accusations the company knowingly shipped defective consoles, and it's finally reached the highest court in America: The Supreme Court.

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda FIXABLE? What's Bioware Doing About It?
attributes.caption: Mar 22, 2017
attributes.description: Mass Effect Andromeda wasn't even out before it started taking the punches for wonky animations, glitches, and impossibly weird character faces. By the way, none of that stuff is minor in development terms. So is it even fixable? And what's Bioware doing to address the complaints? Can Mass Effect still be saved?
attributes.display_title: Mass Effect Andromeda FIXABLE? What's Bioware Doing About It?

attributes.title: Nintendo ADMITS to Nintendo Switch Joy Con DEFECT
attributes.caption: Mar 23, 2017
attributes.description: Even before Nintendo switch launched, people who got hands on the console reported issues with joy cons desyncing from the console unexpectedly. Even after launch Nintendo downplayed the issue, but now admit that some of the joy cons suffered a manufacturing issue that require you to send your joy con in for repair.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo ADMITS to Nintendo Switch Joy Con DEFECT

attributes.title: Destiny 2 LEAKS! Release Date! Beta! Platforms!
attributes.caption: Mar 23, 2017
attributes.description: Destiny 2 may be the worst kept secret in the gaming industry, but that won't stop it from springing a leak! New marketing materials have outed the game's release date, beta details, and even platform details before the game is officially announced.
attributes.display_title: Destiny 2 LEAKS! Release Date! Beta! Platforms!

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Tax STRIKES AGAIN! Why Are Games $10 More?
attributes.caption: Mar 24, 2017
attributes.description: More games for Nintendo Switch are being priced at $10 extra. Where's this tax coming from? Cartridge production costs? Then why does it affect digital versions too? Let's discuss.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch Tax STRIKES AGAIN! Why Are Games $10 More?

attributes.title: The Life and Death of Nintendo VIRTUAL BOY
attributes.caption: Mar 26, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo was accustomed to runaway successes in the '80s and '90s--NES, SNES, Game Boy... and then there was the Virtual Boy. It was the company's first attempt at VR, and one that still influences VR work today.
attributes.display_title: The Life and Death of Nintendo VIRTUAL BOY

attributes.title: Call of Duty: World War II LEAKS
attributes.caption: Mar 27, 2017
attributes.description: Those earlier rumors that Call of Duty is returning to World War 2 seem to have merit! New marketing materials have leaked ahead of the game's announcement.
attributes.display_title: Call of Duty: World War II LEAKS

attributes.title: GameStop CLOSING STORES!
attributes.caption: Mar 27, 2017
attributes.description: GameStop is closing hundreds of stores as a down year for physical game sales puts more pressure on the giant retailer.

attributes.title: Which Console Gets MOST LOVE From Media?
attributes.caption: Mar 28, 2017
attributes.description: A new study breaks down the amount of coverage different consoles get. How does that relate to which consoles are selling best? Let's take a look.
attributes.display_title: Which Console Gets MOST LOVE From Media?

attributes.title: Microsoft Talks Xbox One's BIG MISTAKE
attributes.caption: Mar 28, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox One has made some missteps with gamers over the last few years, but the most notable one was the announcement of their new console, which immediately turned gamers against them. Fortunately, Microsoft seems to be taking the feedback onboard and acknowledging that... yeah, they messed up. Hopefully this is a good sign for what's next?
attributes.display_title: Microsoft Talks Xbox One's BIG MISTAKE

attributes.title: Persona 5... IS IT GOOD?
attributes.caption: Mar 29, 2017
attributes.description: Reviews are in for upcoming JRPG Persona 5, the (you guessed it) fifth entry in the popular franchise from Atlus. Now that the critics are weighing in, we can take a look at what they're saying, how they're stacking it against previous entries, and answer the big question... IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: Cyberpunk TRADEMARKED! Has CD Projekt RED Gone Too Far?
attributes.caption: Mar 31, 2017
attributes.description: No, it's not King going nuts with the trademarks... not this time. It's actually beloved Witcher developer CD Projekt RED. The company is attempting to copyright the word Cyberpunk so no one can use that word in a video game name. Thing is... they didn't invent that word and it refers to a whole genre, so...
attributes.display_title: Cyberpunk TRADEMARKED! Has CD Projekt RED Gone Too Far?

attributes.title: Project Scorpio To Be Revealed THIS WEEK?
attributes.caption: Apr 3, 2017
attributes.description: Looks like we won't have to wait long to hear more about Project Scorpio. The rumor mill is buzzing, and it looks like we may get to hear more about Microsoft's next console as soon as this week.
attributes.display_title: Project Scorpio To Be Revealed THIS WEEK?

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda... WHAT WENT WRONG
attributes.caption: Apr 3, 2017
attributes.description: Were Mass Effect Andromeda's worst parts outsourced? One report says that's the case, so now you know who to get mad at about everything that went wrong with Andromeda.
attributes.display_title: Mass Effect Andromeda... WHAT WENT WRONG

attributes.title: Steam cracking down on FAKE GAMES?
attributes.display_title: Steam cracking down on FAKE GAMES?

attributes.title: Streamers RUINING Games?
attributes.caption: Apr 5, 2017
attributes.description: Are streamers and let's players RUINING games? One publisher is taking a stand and it's... Atlus? Yep. In a very Japanese move, the Persona 5 publisher is putting restrictions on what can be streamed, and they're threatening copyright strikes against anyone who doesn't comply.

attributes.title: Xbox Scorpio Reveal DISAPPOINTING or SAVING XBOX
attributes.caption: Apr 6, 2017
attributes.description: As promised, Microsoft has revealed Xbox's Project Scorpio this week! Sort of. You can't see it. It doesn't have a name. Or a date. Or a price. But there are a lot of tech specs so that's something.
attributes.display_title: Xbox Scorpio Reveal DISAPPOINTING or SAVING XBOX

attributes.title: Xbox Scorpio Will Be $700? Outsell PS4? ANALYSTS GO WILD!
attributes.caption: Apr 7, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox's Project Scorpio got a hardware reveal yesterday and there's a lot of power under that hood. Now, analysts are going nuts making predictions. WHAT DOES IT ALL MEAN? WILL IT SAVE XBOX? Let's break it down.
attributes.display_title: Xbox Scorpio Will Be $700? Outsell PS4? ANALYSTS GO WILD!

attributes.title: G2A Gearbox Deal MELTDOWN
attributes.caption: Apr 7, 2017
attributes.description: Earlier this week Gearbox Software announced a partnership with controversial steam key reseller G2A to distribute the collector's edition of Bulletstorm: Full Clip on PC. Since then it's been a real rollercoaster of calls for boycotts, demands, and now a meltdown of the whole thing. Here's what you need to know.

attributes.title: KOTOR Getting a REBOOT? New Leak!
attributes.caption: Apr 10, 2017
attributes.description: Knights of the Old Republic is one of the franchises that put Bioware on the map. Now EA's got the Star Wars license for video games and a new leak says Bioware is hard at work on a KOTOR reboot for the new canon.
attributes.display_title: KOTOR Getting a REBOOT? New Leak!

attributes.title: G2A Fights Back
attributes.caption: Apr 11, 2017
attributes.description: Steam key reseller G2A has been in more trouble than usual with the gaming community after a partnership with Gearbox went south over demands about changes to the platform. But G2A's not going to take the criticism lying down. OH NO. They're going to stand up for it!

attributes.title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 LEAK! Campaign First Details
attributes.caption: Apr 12, 2017
attributes.description: Plan on a very Star Wars kind of week thanks to Star Wars Celebration happening in Florida. To kick it off early, the teaser for Star Wars Battlefront 2 has leaked ahead of the event, revealing details about the campaign, plus a bunch of the different Star Wars characters you'll see in the game.
attributes.display_title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 LEAK! Campaign First Details

attributes.title: The Plan for XBOX SCORPIO
attributes.caption: Apr 12, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox has revealed the dev kit for Xbox Scorpio, which may hint at what to expect for the console itself. Plus, they're teasing the future of games and how they want to break free of console generations.

attributes.title: Xbox One to Offer REFUNDS
attributes.caption: Apr 13, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox is taking another page out of Steam's book. Microsoft is set to begin offering refunds for digital games under certain conditions, which may put a dent in the sales of games that release with glaring issues.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch NEW GAMES for 2017! Is It Enough?
attributes.caption: Apr 13, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has announced a bunch of new games and set some game release dates for 2017. There aren't enough to really fill out the year yet, and a lot of the games coming to the system are old ports, so there are still some issues to overcome, but all the first party efforts are looking pretty solid.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch NEW GAMES for 2017! Is It Enough?

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch OFFICIALLY Best Launch Ever! - The Know Game News
attributes.caption: Apr 14, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch is officially Nintendo's biggest hardware launch of all time, even outpacing launches like the Game Boy. There's also a truly puzzling statistic that shows more people bought copies of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild for Nintendo Switch than the actual Nintendo Switch. Have fun with that one, statistics nerds!
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch OFFICIALLY Best Launch Ever! - The Know Game News

attributes.title: 2017 the Best Year for Games EVER? What's STILL COMING
attributes.caption: Apr 15, 2017
attributes.description: 2017 has already been a strong year for big games--Resident Evil VII, Horizon: Zero Dawn, The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild... here's the thing. There's SO MUCH MORE still coming. Let's run down all the biggest games still set to release this year so you can start crying into your wallet.
attributes.display_title: 2017 the Best Year for Games EVER? What's STILL COMING

attributes.title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 FIXES EVERYTHING?
attributes.caption: Apr 17, 2017
attributes.description: We've got more details on Star Wars Battlefront 2, which is due out later this year. And it looks like all those online petitions and boycotts and reddit threads may have had an impact, because this game seems set to fix a lot of the issues players had the first time around. And also EA really wants players to stick around longer than a week or two this time.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch MINI? Um...
attributes.caption: Apr 17, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has been a hit so far, leading analysts to gaze deep into their psychedelic crystal balls and make predictions about what's next. Following in the wisdom of internet comments everywhere, one analyst thinks we'll see a mini version of the console in 2 years. But before we throw out our giant Switch consoles, let's take a look at Nintendo's history of hardware revisions to see how likely that is.

attributes.title: The New STEAM KILLER?
attributes.caption: Apr 18, 2017
attributes.description: A lot of companies have tried to take aim at Steam in the last few years. EA, Ubisoft, GOG, Facebook... so far none of them have made a dent. But could WeGame be the one to take them down?

attributes.title: Game Devs vs Media "Frustum Culling" Uproar EXPLAINED
attributes.caption: Apr 18, 2017
attributes.description: Have you ever heard of frustum culling? If you're a game developer, you probably have. Otherwise, maybe not? But either way, this development technique has accidentally set off a dispute between some indie developers and games media publications like Polygon and Kotaku, who are also at odds. And frankly, the whole thing is a bit silly.
attributes.display_title: Game Devs vs Media "Frustum Culling" Uproar EXPLAINED

attributes.title: Nintendo SNES Classic Mini THIS YEAR?
attributes.caption: Apr 19, 2017
attributes.description: A new report claims the reason Nintendo discontinued the NES Classic Edition is because they're hard at work on their next project for this year: an SNES Classic Edition. If so, Nintendo is crazy, but with their track record we can't really rule it out.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo SNES Classic Mini THIS YEAR?

attributes.title: The Witcher Creator BLASTS Video Games
attributes.caption: Apr 19, 2017
attributes.description: The original creator of The Witcher has... some thoughts about video games as a medium and who made who a success. And he's not happy about all the punk kids who think his books are adaptations of the game.
attributes.display_title: The Witcher Creator BLASTS Video Games

attributes.title: What Can Xbox Scorpio Learn from the Nintendo Switch Launch?
attributes.caption: Apr 21, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has been a huge success so far, turning around the company's financials and leaving the troubles of Wii U in the dust. Xbox has been having its own troubles this generation too. What can Microsoft learn from Nintendo's 180 to make Scorpio equally successful?
attributes.display_title: What Can Xbox Scorpio Learn from the Nintendo Switch Launch?

attributes.title: G2A UNDER FIRE from Developers
attributes.caption: Apr 20, 2017
attributes.description: G2A's been in hot water with developers recently. Since their deal with Gearbox to distribute Bulletstorm: Full Clip fell apart over accusations that the Steam key reseller operates a grey marketplace, they've been struggling to get their message across. Which is why a G2A rep decided to present at a developers conference. What could go wrong?

attributes.title: Ubisoft #1 in 2017!
attributes.caption: Apr 21, 2017
attributes.description: Despite the boycotts and the quietish launches, it looks like the #1 game publisher for 2017 so far is Ubisoft! So there's a surprise. While they're not generating the most noise they ARE generating the most money, with the 2 top grossing games of the year up to this point.

attributes.title: Call of Duty: World War II CONFIRMED!
attributes.caption: Apr 21, 2017
attributes.description: Remember all those marketing material leaks that said Call of Duty was returning to World War 2? They were right on the money. Logo and everything. Activision has now confirmed the game with more details to come.
attributes.display_title: Call of Duty: World War II CONFIRMED!

attributes.title: Does KickStarter Create BAD GAMES?
attributes.caption: Apr 23, 2017
attributes.description: Recently, KickStarter's lost favor with gamers, who are using the platform to fund games less than they used to. Part of this is because a lot of recent crowdfunded games haven't been great, but just how true is that? Does KickStarter lead to bad games?

attributes.title: Games TOO EXPENSIVE to Succeed?
attributes.caption: Apr 24, 2017
attributes.description: In an age where selling millions of copies isn't good enough, some are asking if games are becoming too expensive to make, so failures can't be tolerated and no one is willing to take risks. Is this the age where indies and AA developers will rise while the behemoths will fall?

attributes.title: Digital vs Physical Games: Who's Winning?
attributes.caption: Apr 25, 2017
attributes.description: Despair, ye physical game faithful. US game sales tracker NPD has finally updated their numbers to account for (most) digital game sales over the last few years, and it looks like physical gaming has lost ground faster than anyone realized.
attributes.display_title: Digital vs Physical Games: Who's Winning?

attributes.title: HOSTILE TAKEOVER for Ubisoft AGAIN?
attributes.caption: Apr 26, 2017
attributes.description: Last year it looked like Ubisoft had survived Vivendi's attempts at a hostile takeover. But that was last year. Now it's this year and it looks like the war's back on.

attributes.title: Did the Switch SAVE Nintendo?
attributes.caption: Apr 27, 2017
attributes.description: We've seen a lot of estimates about how Nintendo Switch is selling and speculation about whether it can help Nintendo turn a profit again. Thanks to Nintendo's investor call we now know how many it sold and what effect it's having.

attributes.title: Rockstar's BULLY 2 Up Next?
attributes.caption: Apr 27, 2017
attributes.description: Rumors of a sequel to the hit game Bully have been flying for years. Now, a leaker with a strong track record of sharing accurate Rockstar info early says Bully's the next project after the release of Red Dead Redemption 2.

attributes.title: Nintendo Announces NEW 2DS XL... But Why?
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Announces NEW 2DS XL... But Why?

attributes.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe - Is It Good?
attributes.display_title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe - Is It Good?

attributes.title: Is the Playstation 5 Coming Next Year?
attributes.display_title: Is the Playstation 5 Coming Next Year?

attributes.title: Darksiders 3 LEAKED! FIRST LOOK!
attributes.caption: May 2, 2017
attributes.description: When the lights at THQ went out it looked like the end of the Darksiders franchise, but no! After leaking via Amazon we've got official confirmation and a first look at what this game has to offer, plus some very very good news for fans of the franchise.

attributes.title: Prey: Should You Be WORRIED?
attributes.caption: May 3, 2017
attributes.description: Prey is coming out soon! Unfortunately for PC gamers, Arkane doesn't have the strongest track record with PC releases and they decided not to release a demo for PC... time to get worried?

attributes.title: MORE TROUBLE for Xbox Exclusives?
attributes.caption: May 3, 2017
attributes.description: Another of Microsoft's anticipated exclusives is having issues. In this case? That it's an original Xbox game that's not being "remastered" so much as "re-released as-is."

attributes.title: Prey vs Prey For The Gods TRADEMARK BATTLE
attributes.caption: May 4, 2017
attributes.description: Prey publisher Bethesda has a history of getting litigious over trademarks over other games. To celebrate the release of Prey they're going after the Kickstarter game Prey For The Gods with a pack of lawyers because gosh those games could be confused.
attributes.display_title: Prey vs Prey For The Gods TRADEMARK BATTLE

attributes.title: Call of Duty WWII TOO VIOLENT for YouTube?
attributes.caption: May 4, 2017
attributes.description: The Adpocalypse has hit a lot of YouTubers pretty hard. Now it's come for the Call of Duty players. Several popular Call of Duty channels are reporting demonetization of videos depicting Call of Duty: World War II or even using the name in their titles. This could have a dramatic impact on channels built around specific games and genres. Are other shooter games next on the chopping block?
attributes.display_title: Call of Duty WWII TOO VIOLENT for YouTube?

attributes.title: Apple BUYS The Video Game Industry?
attributes.caption: May 5, 2017
attributes.description: Apple has an awful lot of extra cash lying around. Usually that means they plan on doing something with it, like buying something BIG. Something like a huge company. While entertainment giants like Disney and Netflix have been thrown around, analysts now predict Apple could decide to buy its way into gaming by taking over the industry's biggest companies.
attributes.display_title: Apple BUYS The Video Game Industry?

attributes.title: Video Game Speedruns: A Quick History
attributes.caption: May 7, 2017
attributes.description: Speedrun culture has been building for decades into what it's become, but how did it get started? Let's take a walk down memory lane.
attributes.display_title: Video Game Speedruns: A Quick History

attributes.title: Assassin's Creed ORIGINS New Details Leak
attributes.caption: May 8, 2017
attributes.description: Assassin's Creed Empire may now be Assassin's Creed Origins and a new leak reveals how the series may have used its break to significantly change the formula for the series.
attributes.display_title: Assassin's Creed ORIGINS New Details Leak

attributes.title: Far Cry 5 STEALS Red Dead Redemption 2's Western Spotlight?
attributes.caption: May 8, 2017
attributes.description: Remember that live action promo being filmed in Montana that sounded an awful lot like Red Dead Redemption 2? Turns out it might actually be for Far Cry 5, which could be a spaghetti western.
attributes.display_title: Far Cry 5 STEALS Red Dead Redemption 2's Western Spotlight?

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 ACTUALLY COMING When!?
attributes.caption: May 9, 2017
attributes.description: Kingdom Hearts fans have been waiting more than 10 years for the 3rd numbered entry in the franchise and now... it might actually be coming out, now that reports claim Square Enix has put their foot down on the release date.

attributes.title: Modder HIJACKS Pirated Games
attributes.caption: May 9, 2017
attributes.description: A popular modder who fixes PC games because the developers didn't has taken a stand against piracy by adding DRM back into a game after pirates cracked it and locking pirates back out. This has the PC gaming up in arms over what modders are allowed to do and whether pirates should be entitled to those mods. Strap in. This is a fun one. But also messy.

attributes.title: MASS EFFECT Franchise on Ice, BioWare New IP Delayed
attributes.caption: May 10, 2017
attributes.description: The Mass Effect franchise has suffered the worst possible setback--being put on ice. That means no more Mass Effect games in the near future, following the backlash against the recently released Mass Effect: Andromeda. Plus, BioWare's new IP looks like it's being delayed to avoid a similar response.
attributes.display_title: MASS EFFECT Franchise on Ice, BioWare New IP Delayed

attributes.title: TWO New METROID Games? Wait...
attributes.caption: May 10, 2017
attributes.description: We've been hearing rumblings that a new Metroid game will be unveiled at E3 this year, but now a leaker claims that not one, but TWO new games are coming. How credible is that though? Well...

attributes.title: NO ONE'S HEARD of Xbox Scorpio or PS4 Pro!?
attributes.caption: May 11, 2017
attributes.description: A new survey out of Nielson claims that very few gamers are aware that Xbox's Project Scorpio is a thing, and many don't even know what the PS4 Pro is. Not you guys. If you're watching game news you're good. But who are all these other people?
attributes.display_title: NO ONE'S HEARD of Xbox Scorpio or PS4 Pro!?

attributes.title: Fan Games Will RUIN YOUR LIFE?
attributes.caption: May 11, 2017
attributes.description: The only thing more reliable than fans creating games based on their favorite properties is game companies sending out cease and desist letters to fans creating games based on their favorite properties. This has been a hot topic lately, as to who's in the wrong. An attorney has weighed in and... well, you probably won't like the answer, but that doesn't make it less true.
attributes.display_title: Fan Games Will RUIN YOUR LIFE?

attributes.title: MINECRAFT: A History Speedrun
attributes.caption: May 12, 2017
attributes.description: Minecraft has just released on Nintendo Switch. You've heard it before. You've seen it before. It's virtually impossible to escape. Well, here's a speedrun of the game's history--how it was made and where it is now.

attributes.title: Xbox's BIG COMEBACK
attributes.caption: May 12, 2017
attributes.description: Is Xbox poised for a big comeback at E3? They're teasing games, Scorpio hardware, and now they've announced a new mixed reality project.

attributes.title: Why Do Consoles Cost Hundreds of Dollars?
attributes.caption: May 13, 2017
attributes.description: Have you ever wondered why a game console costs hundreds of dollars, when the same hardware in a PC can be bought cheaper? Wonder no more.
attributes.display_title: Why Do Consoles Cost Hundreds of Dollars?

attributes.title: ZELDA & ANIMAL CROSSING Coming to Mobile!
attributes.caption: May 15, 2017
attributes.description: Last year it was Pokemon and Mario. Now it's time for Zelda and Animal Crossing to get the mobile game treatment. Are they going paid or freemium? What can you expect from these new games?
attributes.display_title: ZELDA & ANIMAL CROSSING Coming to Mobile!

attributes.title: Good Guy Valve is BAD FOR GAMES? oh boy
attributes.caption: May 16, 2017
attributes.description: A new editorial accuses "good guy Valve" of being nothing more than a cynical mask worn to get into the wallets of gamers. Here's the thing. HERE'S THE THING... there are some interesting points hidden inside the incendiary language.
attributes.display_title: Good Guy Valve is BAD FOR GAMES? oh boy

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch TOO SUCCESSFUL for Nintendo to Handle?
attributes.caption: May 17, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch launched strong, but sales numbers have dropped pretty hard, and it's not because people aren't trying to buy it. Nintendo just can't seem to keep up. Is this NES Classic all over again with artificial shortages or is Nintendo just not able to build enough new consoles?
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch TOO SUCCESSFUL for Nintendo to Handle?

attributes.title: FEWER GAMES for Ubisoft! All in on Microtransactions!
attributes.caption: May 17, 2017
attributes.description: According to a new investor briefing, Ubisoft is going to start releasing fewer games and capitalizing on post-launch monetization of consumers. That's an investor-friendly way of saying "we're going to chuck tons of microtransactions in these games because they make us SO MUCH MONEY." So... RIP Beyond Good & Evil 2 and UbiArt games, apparently.
attributes.display_title: FEWER GAMES for Ubisoft! All in on Microtransactions!

attributes.title: Destiny 2 GAMEPLAY Reveal! Everything You Need to Know
attributes.caption: May 18, 2017
attributes.description: Destiny 2 got its big coming out party with a reveal of the gameplay and tons of changes coming to Bungie's big sequel to Destiny. We've got details on dates, platforms, specs, matchmaking, pvp, maps, orbits, travellers... Let's run through everything they said, some things they didn't say, and what it all means.
attributes.display_title: Destiny 2 GAMEPLAY Reveal! Everything You Need to Know

attributes.title: Is Activision Taking on Steam?
attributes.caption: Destiny 2 is coming exclusively to Battle.net -- or the Blizzard app, if you want to get technical about it. Now, Activision-Blizzard isn't being super clear on what that might mean for future Activision games. Do they want to knock Steam off its throne?

attributes.title: How E3 Became Gaming's Biggest Event!
attributes.display_title: How E3 Became Gaming's Biggest Event!

attributes.title: Where Did Microtransactions Come From?
attributes.caption: Love them or hate them, microtransactions have become synonymous with modern gaming.  But how did these little exchanges start, and how did we get from horse armor to loot boxes?

attributes.title: Critical YouTuber THREATENED by Game Publisher
attributes.caption: May 22, 2017
attributes.description: A popular World of Tanks YouTuber has been threatened by the game's publisher over critical comments he made in a video about an update to the game. The publisher has threatened to issue a copyright strike against his video for... uh... swearing. Has anyone told them that's not how copyright strikes work?
attributes.display_title: Critical YouTuber THREATENED by Game Publisher

attributes.title: Project Scorpio HELD BACK by Xbox One?! and other conspiracies
attributes.caption: May 22, 2017
attributes.description: Bungie's not talking Xbox Scorpio yet, but it looks like the consoles will all be locked to 30FPS for Destiny 2, even though Scorpio should be able to handle more. Is Microsoft hamstringing their own console? Is Sony paying Bungie to make it suck on Xbox? Or is it because they're releasing a game before a platform is out? Hmmmmmmmmmm
attributes.display_title: Project Scorpio HELD BACK by Xbox One?! and other conspiracies

attributes.title: Xbox Live HACKED?
attributes.caption: May 23, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox Live has been compromised by a Chinese company that's stealing accounts and using victims' credit cards to buy and sell online goods.

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 GOES DARK
attributes.caption: May 24, 2017
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 was officially delayed earlier this week. If you were hoping to learn more about it at e3 anyway... bad news.

attributes.title: Xbox Game Pass OUT NOW! Exactly What Xbox Needed?
attributes.caption: May 24, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox Game Pass got a surprise release for Xbox Live Gold members today with a healthy mix of Xbox One and Xbox 360 titles to choose from. Is this what Xbox needed to transform its model?
attributes.display_title: Xbox Game Pass OUT NOW! Exactly What Xbox Needed?

attributes.title: Far Cry 5 TOO CONTROVERSIAL?
attributes.caption: May 25, 2017
attributes.description: Ubisoft release their big teaser image for Far Cry 5 ahead of the game's trailer, and it's started a whirlwind of debate online over whether the game is going too far by setting white Americans as the bad guys.

attributes.title: Far Cry 5 RELEASE DATE! DETAILS! CULTISTS! What You Should Know
attributes.caption: May 26, 2017
attributes.description: Far Cry 5's been kicking up some good old controversy over its setting, but the new trailer looks pretty darn cool. Doomsday religious cultists, bear attacks, planes, AMERICAN TIGERS WHICH ARE DEFINITELY A REAL THING, cows, guns, mercenaries... we've got the details.
attributes.display_title: Far Cry 5 RELEASE DATE! DETAILS! CULTISTS! What You Should Know

attributes.title: FFVII Remake & Kingdom Hearts 3 are the NEW HITMAN?
attributes.caption: May 26, 2017
attributes.description: Hitman was an episodic, games-as-a-service experiment for Square-Enix. That one didn't do well enough to keep the publisher from axing the studio. But maybe... MAYBE... if they just try it with Final Fantasy and Kingdom Hearts it will work this time? Get ready for games as a service instead of games as...games!
attributes.display_title: FFVII Remake & Kingdom Hearts 3 are the NEW HITMAN?

attributes.title: The Biggest BROKEN PROMISES of E3
attributes.caption: May 29, 2017
attributes.description: E3 is coming up and it's going to be a big year. Nintendo's going hard with the Switch, Xbox is bringing Scorpio, PlayStation is working hard to keep its lead. Just remember... not every promise gets kept. Here are some of the times we got excited for big E3 games, only to end up disappointed.
attributes.display_title: The Biggest BROKEN PROMISES of E3

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Shortage is APPLE'S FAULT?
attributes.caption: May 30, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo is trying to ramp up production on the Switch to meet demand, but may face a surprising obstacle: Apple. They're now competing for parts that can't be manufactured in high enough quantities.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch Shortage is APPLE'S FAULT?

attributes.title: WTF Nintendo Switch Voice Chat?
attributes.caption: June 1, 2017
attributes.description: NIntendo's been doing so well with the Switch launch you KNEW the other shoe had to drop sooner or later. Hori has unveiled their voice chat headset for Splatoon 2, and if this is what the console's voice chat is going to look like it's going to be a mess.

attributes.title: Microsoft STALKING Nintendo Switch? Hmmm
attributes.caption: June 1, 2017
attributes.description: Look, we get it. Nintendo Switch is that new kid in your class who seems really cool and suddenly everyone wants to be their friend and you're sitting there by yourself asking, "Why not me?" Microsoft has decided WHY NOT, INDEED and they seem to be taking aim at Nintendo's new console by trying to figure out what it is that makes everyone like it and give it a pass even though it doesn't have a ton of exclusives (yet) either.

attributes.title: Will PlayStation DOMINATE E3?
attributes.caption: Everyone's excited about Scorpio and Switch heading into E3, but Sony says it's not all that worried about the competition. With the company teasing major announcements for next week, could they be on the verge of dominating E3 this year?

attributes.title: Pokemon Announcements DISAPPOINTING?
attributes.caption: It's that time of year again, when everyone starts hyping themselves up for unsubstantiated rumors and then gets mad when the rumors aren't real! Nintendo's Pokemon Direct hit this morning and... things didn't quite go as planned. But at least we've still

attributes.title: Everything CONFIRMED for E3
attributes.caption: Everybody's got big expectations heading into E3 this weekend, and not all of those are based on reality. We've put together a definitive list of all the pre-show announcements, what's confirmed, and what won't be at the show. Is your favorite game on the

attributes.title: No Man's Sky Developer Sending ARG Cassettes Tapes
attributes.caption: Is No Man's Sky planning a huge update just in time for E3? Well, they're planning something, because they're starting a huge ARG with the game's remaining players. Is there anybody left to uncover the secrets?
attributes.display_title: No Man's Sky Developer Sending ARG Cassettes Tapes

attributes.title: Why Mass Effect Andromeda Was a Disaster
attributes.display_title: Why Mass Effect Andromeda Was a Disaster

attributes.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Held HOSTAGE!
attributes.caption: You all wanted some new information about Cyberpunk 2077... but probably not like this. It looks like some hackers have stolen some assets from CD Projekt Red, and they're going to release them unless the company pays the ransom.

attributes.title: Microsoft's Pre-E3 Trash Talk
attributes.caption: Microsoft's teasing some possible Scorpio release date information... along with some trash talk about Sony's PlayStation 4 Pro. They're not the only ones firing shots ahead of E3, though.

attributes.title: Take-Two Shuts Down GTAV Mods!
attributes.caption: The Grand Theft Auto playerbase is none too pleased after Rockstar shut down a bunch of GTA mods. And now, they're fighting back in the only way they know how - negative reviewing the crap out of the franchise on Steam.

attributes.title: Sony KILLING Crossplay?
attributes.caption: The dream of cross-platform play is quickly becoming a reality... well, almost. It looks like Sony is blocking crossplay from happening in a number of upcoming games, and may even stop it from happening for one of next year's biggest titles, Red Dead Rede

attributes.title: Nintendo APOLOGIZES for Nintendo Switch
attributes.caption: June 22, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo is sorry. You hear? SORRY! Sorry you can't give them your money! They want it! They just can't make enough of the consoles to meet demand in most markets. And what's the chance this could eat into the console's maximum potential?

attributes.title: PS4 Devs Mock Xbox One
attributes.caption: What's better than some good old-fashioned console wars silliness? Well a whole lot, actually, which is probably why people are so annoyed with the developers of the PS4 exclusive Detroit -- who tweeted out some not nice things about the Xbox this last we

attributes.title: SNES Classic Edition CONFIRMED!
attributes.caption: June 26, 2017
attributes.description: Ok, so this isn't the biggest surprise in the world. The SNES Classic Mini has been officially announced by Nintendo. BUT is this actually what we were hoping for? It costs more, has fewer games, and is going to create all kinds of confusion for Nintendo Switch's first holiday. Compared to the NES Classic it's... almost a rip-off?

attributes.title: DMCA EXTORTIONIST Drags YouTubers into Legal Battle
attributes.caption: June 26, 2017
attributes.description: The developers of a Kickstarter game called Starr Mazer brought on well known chiptunes composer Alex Mauer to create the soundtrack. That sounds like a great idea! Unfortunately, it gets not-so-great when the composer decides you owe her more money and she decides to issue DMCA strikes against any YouTube video showing the game and using the music and threatens to kill their channels unless they complain about the developer.
attributes.display_title: DMCA EXTORTIONIST Drags YouTubers into Legal Battle

attributes.title: SNES Mini SOLD OUT Already?
attributes.caption: We're only one day into the reality where the SNES Classic is real and confirmed, and already there's shortage. Plus, Nintendo's confirmed it'll be a limited run. If the consoles are selling out in different parts of the world and being hawked by scalpers

attributes.title: Gamers Not READY for 4K?
attributes.caption: Microsoft's pumping up the Xbox One X, but it looks like the 4K revolution won't be here without some growing pains first -- and these kinds of things are why Nintendo is saying that gamers just aren't ready for 4K yet. Which company has correctly predi

attributes.title: G2A Goes LEGIT?
attributes.caption: June 28, 2017
attributes.description: G2A's been under fire from gamers and developers lately over grey market practices that enable scammers to sell illegally obtained games. Now, it looks like they might be turning over a new leaf. Maybe.

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda DLC HOAX!
attributes.caption: June 29, 2017
attributes.description: News went around earlier today that Mass Effect Andromeda wasn't just on ice, but so was all its planned story DLC. YIKES! Put down the pitch forks though, because it was FAKE NEWS!

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch TROUBLE with Publishers?
attributes.caption: June 30, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has been selling well, but it may be in trouble with third party developers who are having a tough time porting their games to the platform and may not be able to make them work at all.

attributes.title: PlayStation STEALS Xbox One X Gameplay!?
attributes.caption: July 3, 2017
attributes.description: Good news! PS4 is getting Bioware's Anthem. Bad news! They used Xbox One X footage to show everyone how awesome it's going to look on PS4!
attributes.display_title: PlayStation STEALS Xbox One X Gameplay!?

attributes.title: Gamers SUCK Now!?
attributes.caption: July 5, 2017
attributes.description: Gamers are getting a helpful reminder about just how challenging video games used to be and how much we all suck at them now, thanks to Crash Bandicoot N.Sane Trilogy. This time when we say, "it's not you, it's me," we might actually mean it. Bummer.

attributes.title: Devs: Nintendo Switch TOO WEAK
attributes.caption: July 6, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch is taking heat from third-party developers who aren't happy with the power the hybrid console has to offer.

attributes.title: Ark RIPS OFF GAMERS?
attributes.caption: July 10, 2017
attributes.description: Ark: Survival Evolved isn't even out yet and it's even making other game developers furious now. What did they do this time? Nothing big. Just, uh, DOUBLED the price of the game and tried to hide behind retailers.

attributes.title: League of Legends Knock-off LAWSUIT & THREATS
attributes.caption: July 11, 2017
attributes.description: League of Legends is no stranger to the courtroom and they kinda miss it. That's why they're going after rip-off games, but their defendant isn't taking it lying down. Nope. They're threatening anyone who says they might be, well, ripping off League of Legends! This should be fun.
attributes.display_title: League of Legends Knock-off LAWSUIT & THREATS

attributes.title: Steam's BIGGEST BAN EVER
attributes.caption: July 11, 2017
attributes.description: Fresh off their annual Summer Sale, Valve has dropped their biggest ban hammer ever. That's good! But why did they wait until all the cheaters handed over their money for their cheater games? That part's a bit weird.

attributes.title: DRM Actually SAVES You Money! But...
attributes.caption: July 12, 2017
attributes.description: A new study shows that DRM means you pay less, BUT there's more to it because that's not necessarily what consumers want.
attributes.display_title: DRM Actually SAVES You Money! But...

attributes.title: Next Console Generation TOO SOON?
attributes.caption: July 13, 2017
attributes.description: Sony's already committed to another console generation with some analysts predicting it within the next year or two, and now it looks like Microsoft is actively developing their next console even though Xbox One X isn't even out yet. IT'S ALL HAPPENING SO FAST. Is it too soon or is this actually normal?

attributes.title: Fans WIN DMCA WAR Against Capcom
attributes.caption: July 14, 2017
attributes.description: Capcom went full DMCA on a YouTube channel subtitling an Ace Attorney spin-off game, but this time the fans decided to fight back.
attributes.display_title: Fans WIN DMCA WAR Against Capcom

attributes.title: Death Threats and NEW DMCA RAMPAGE: Alex Mauer Strikes Again
attributes.caption: July 14, 2017
attributes.description: Not long ago we did a report on video game composer Alex Mauer, who went on a DMCA rampage after determining that a game studio that hired her owed her more money. Now she's at it again with a completely different game and she's even been arrested for making death threats. It's... a whole mess.
attributes.display_title: Death Threats and NEW DMCA RAMPAGE: Alex Mauer Strikes Again

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 Delays: WHO'S TO BLAME?
attributes.caption: July 17, 2017
attributes.description: Great news! Kingdom Hearts 3 finally has a release window! And Toy Story world is confirmed! Less great... director Tetsuya Nomura's blaming Square-Enix for the game's long development.
attributes.display_title: Kingdom Hearts 3 Delays: WHO'S TO BLAME?

attributes.title: Bioware SAVED? Major Studio Shakeup
attributes.caption: July 18, 2017
attributes.description: Bioware's taken a couple major hits with gamers lately--most notably with the release of Mass Effect: Andromeda, which failed to please critically or commercially. Now their top exec is out and an old veteran returns to steer the ship. Is this how they get back on track with Anthem?

attributes.title: Splatoon 2: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.caption: July 18, 2017
attributes.description: The reviews for Splatoon 2 are in, and we've had some hands-on time ourselves. Is it worth picking up? We've got answers for you!

attributes.title: Ubisoft Wants to STEAL Player Unknown's Battlegrounds?
attributes.caption: July 19, 2017
