attributes.description: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds is making a real splash in the online gaming scene. So much so that Ubisoft wants to get in on all that sweet battle royale money for their own games.
attributes.display_title: Ubisoft Wants to STEAL Player Unknown's Battlegrounds?

attributes.title: Nintendo's Voice Chat App DISASTER
attributes.caption: July 20, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo's finally launched its long-criticized voice app... and the results might be even more disastrous than people first feared. We dig through all of the responses to Nintendo's new complicated voice client, which is actually a pretty big task... because seriously, people have a lot to say about this. Like a whole lot.

attributes.title: Guardians HATE Destiny 2 Beta?
attributes.caption: July 20, 2017
attributes.description: Destiny 2's beta has barely been alive for a hot minute, but already the fire from Guardians is real. Players have responded en masse to the game's changes on Reddit, accusing Bungie of favoring multiplayer and losing sight of what made Destiny great -- is this just the case of gamers feeling entitled, or do they have a point?

attributes.title: PlayStation Witch Hunt GOES TOO FAR?
attributes.caption: July 24, 2017
attributes.description: Playstation 4's SDK has leaked, and Sony will go to any lengths to try to squash it--including sending their lawyers after discussions and completely unrelated websites.
attributes.display_title: PlayStation Witch Hunt GOES TOO FAR?

attributes.title: Game Pass SAVES Xbox?
attributes.caption: July 21, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox hardware sales have fallen off steeply, but Microsoft's games business may have an unlikely savior. Hero enters, stage right. The crowd gasps. A woman faints. A bystander points and cries, "is that Game Pass?!" It is.

attributes.title: Pokemon Go Fest a TOTAL DISASTER
attributes.caption: July 24, 2017
attributes.description: This weekend thousands of Pokemon Go superfans traveled to Chicago to be the first in the world to catch legendary pokemon during Niantic's official Pokemon Go Fest. Unfortunately, EVERYTHING went wrong. Does it join the ranks of Fyre Festival? DashCon? Well, there's no ball pit...
attributes.display_title: Pokemon Go Fest a TOTAL DISASTER

attributes.title: Microsoft HOLDING BACK Xbox Investment?
attributes.caption: July 24, 2017
attributes.description: Is Xbox's exclusive problem a result of Microsoft refusing to invest more in the platform? That's what a source who's leaked accurate Xbox details in the past is claiming.

attributes.title: SNES Classic Orders CANCELLED
attributes.caption: July 25, 2017
attributes.description: North American gamers have been not-so-patiently waiting for SNES Classic pre-orders to open up, and they finally did! The next obvious step is to cancel all the orders! Of course.

attributes.title: Gaming's Money-Making Nostalgia Machine
attributes.caption: July 25, 2017
attributes.description: As evidenced recently by the NES Classic and the resurgence in repackaged classic consoles, remakes of games outselling new IPs, and more remasters than ever, gamers are suckers for nostalgia. We'll pay good money for old stuff, and gaming companies know it. There's even science behind it.

attributes.title: Switch is #1 Console?
attributes.caption: July 26, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch is on track to sell better than the Wii, which is big news. That would make it Nintendo's best-selling console EVER. Potentially bigger news is that if Nintendo can keep the supply up their new hybrid console is tracking to sell on level with PS4.

attributes.title: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds RUINED?
attributes.caption: July 26, 2017
attributes.description: PUBG has taken the PC gaming world by storm since March, and sold more than 5 million copies before it even releases. So far so good. Unfortunately, now microtransactions are coming to the game and it's not clear whether the current progression system will even be around once they can charge you extra for loot.

attributes.title: Developer SUING GAMERS Over Criticism!?
attributes.caption: July 27, 2017
attributes.description: When you're a developer you want people to like your game and say nice things about it. And if you have to get the LAW involved to make that happen, YOU'RE GOING TO DO IT!

attributes.title: TOO SEXY for Steam
attributes.caption: July 27, 2017
attributes.description: A game called House Party has been removed from Steam after complaints about its sexual content. Just what was it about THIS game in particular that made it too sexy for Steam? Maybe the lewdness? Sexually predatory behavior? BOOBS? And is that fair or is it censorship?

attributes.title: Pokémon Go Fest LAWSUIT
attributes.caption: July 28, 2017
attributes.description: Everyone agrees that PokМђејМў‰вВеўМђе_Мве©mon Go Fest was kind of a disaster. Some people take that more seriously than others. Some people lodge lawsuits over it. Like these guys.

attributes.title: Crash Bandicoot LEAKED for Xbox One?
attributes.caption: July 31, 2017
attributes.description: Crash Bandicoot: N.Sane Trilogy has been one of PS4's biggest sellers this year. But it looks like it may not be staying exclusive after all...
attributes.display_title: Crash Bandicoot LEAKED for Xbox One?

attributes.title: GTA SUED by PSYCHICS
attributes.caption: Aug 1, 2017
attributes.description: GTA is headed to court AGAIN! Except this time it's not an offended starlet looking for a payday. It's...PSYCHICS!

attributes.title: Bioware Montreal SHUT DOWN
attributes.caption: Aug 1, 2017
attributes.description: There's been speculation about trouble for BioWare's Montreal studio--the studio behind the poorly received Mass Effect: Andromeda. Now EA's ripped the bandage off and announced that the studio's shutting down and the developers are being shuffled into projects at Motive instead. So... RIP Quarian Ark DLC, probably.

attributes.title: Studio RUNS OFF with $660K Kickstarter Funds
attributes.caption: Aug 2, 2017
attributes.description: After languishing in Kickstarter limbo for years beyond the promised release date, Unsung Story developer Playdek has decided they're done with the project. Not completed. They just aren't going to work on it anymore. Instead they've farmed it off to a studio known primarily for childrens licensed games, and that studio's going to have to start all over.
attributes.display_title: Studio RUNS OFF with $660K Kickstarter Funds

attributes.title: WHAT IS HAPPENING with Red Dead Redemption 2 on PC?
attributes.caption: Aug 3, 2017
attributes.description: Time for investor season and all the fun news game publishers like to trot out to brag to their investors about all the ways they've got money out of their endless piggy-banks (that's us, the gamers!). Or, in Take-Two's case, tap-dancing around any confirmation or denial of a PC version for Red Dead Redemption 2.
attributes.display_title: WHAT IS HAPPENING with Red Dead Redemption 2 on PC?

attributes.title: Destiny 2 LIMITS Streaming?
attributes.caption: Destiny 2's beta is coming to PC soon, but it's not all rejoicing in PC gamer land. That's because Bungie's just announced that they'll be restricting the features of certain streaming, voice chat, and hardware monitoring programs while you fiendishly hun

attributes.title: Activision MILKING Remasters?
attributes.caption: Activision's got a fever, and the only cure is more remasters. Crash Bandicoot's N. Sane Trilogy has convinced the company that they need to pull out the old IP bin, and dust everything off for future remastered treatment. Does this mean DJ Hero? Prototyp

attributes.title: Shadow of War Microtransaction Controversy
attributes.caption: Shadow of War's got microtransactions, everybody -- just what a singleplayer game needs. And because of that, we got a little bit of mixed messaging about whether or not the game will require an always online connection. We've been through this before, an

attributes.title: Valve's New CASHGRAB?
attributes.caption: Aug 9, 2017
attributes.description: Valve has FINALLY announced a new game! It can still happen! They still make them! As long as there's some kind of crazy trend that will make them a boatload of money, that is. Not one of the games anyone was actually hoping for.

attributes.title: Video Games SHRINK YOUR BRAIN? Uh... no
attributes.caption: Aug 10, 2017
attributes.description: A new study's come out that shows shooter games can result in the loss of gray matter in the hippocampus. TIME TO PANIC? Not exactly.
attributes.display_title: Video Games SHRINK YOUR BRAIN? Uh... no

attributes.title: Insane Fidget Spinner GOLD VAPE DLC Costs 50x More Than The Game
attributes.caption: Aug 9, 2017
attributes.description: So you thought fidget spinners were a passing trend. So did we, until we caught Jon Risinger with one unironically. Honestly we probably sell them now because there's some kind of legislation requiring we hop on the bandwagon. Anyway, if you want to pay $50 for a pretend gold fidget spinner and vape pen you can now. Here's hoping I get kidnapped by aliens any day now.
attributes.display_title: Insane Fidget Spinner GOLD VAPE DLC Costs 50x More Than The Game

attributes.title: Metroid Game Mode Held HOSTAGE
attributes.caption: Aug 9, 2017
attributes.description: Metroid: Samus Returns is the perfect game to tide gamers over until Metroid Prime 4, except for one thing: Nintendo may have overstepped with its exclusive amiibo content this time around by locking an entire game mode behind an amiibo that costs almost as much as the game.

attributes.title: No Man's Sky SURPRISE MULTIPLAYER
attributes.caption: Aug 11, 2017
attributes.description: One year after its heavily-criticized release, No Man's Sky's developer, Hello Games, has dropped an enormous update that take the first multiplayer steps for the game.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch LAWSUIT to Stop Sales!?
attributes.caption: Aug 11, 2017
attributes.description: You thought you had trouble buying a Nintendo Switch now? Just wait! They're being taken to court by a company claiming they have the patent for joy cons, and they're asking the court to pull Nintendo Switch from store shelves!
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch LAWSUIT to Stop Sales!?

attributes.title: For Honor Comeback Celebration EMBARRASSING?
attributes.caption: Aug 14, 2017
attributes.description: For Honor's dropping a new update, adding dedicated servers... all good things! Unfortunately, the tournament they held to celebrate was an embarrassing mess that just highlighted how far they still have to go.

attributes.title: Blizzard Admits BIG MISTAKE
attributes.caption: Aug 15, 2017
attributes.description: We all make mistakes. But you don't mess with Battle.net, even if you're Blizzard. You know what happens when you try to rename it? Everyone ignores you.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch GETS BENT
attributes.caption: Aug 16, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch is selling like crazy, and some early adopters are running into that good old "bendy Switch" issue again, and in greater numbers. Still, it's got a long way to go before it becomes a red ring level issue.

attributes.title: Steam CONTROLLING Small Developers?
attributes.caption: Valve made some indie developers a little upset this week when they seemed to announce that they were going to start limiting free Steam keys. Is this just a means to exercise control of developers outside of Steam, an innocent way of controlling the rise

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda ABANDONED
attributes.caption: Aug 21, 2017
attributes.description: It's official. Mass Effect Andromeda is dead after 5 months. No campaign DLC. No patches. Take it out back and bury it.

attributes.title: Battlegrounds: Xbox Exclusive OR NOT?
attributes.caption: Aug 21, 2017
attributes.description: Since Battlegrounds was announced for Xbox One there's been a lot of confusion over whether it's actually an exclusive or just a timed exclusive. Microsoft and Bluehole decided to clear all that up at Gamescom.... sorta?

attributes.title: SNES Classic Edition SOLD OUT
attributes.caption: Aug 22, 2017
attributes.description: SNES Classic pre-orders are finally here! AAAAnnnnnndd they're gone. Thanks, Nintendo.

attributes.title: Xbox One Has the BIGGEST EXCLUSIVES? ...
attributes.caption: Aug 23, 2017
attributes.description: Xbox is talking the talk at Gamescom. In spite of delays that put Crackdown 3 and State of Decay 2 both out of 2017, one Xbox marketing exec thinks Xbox is just delivering too many huge exclusives to handle.
attributes.display_title: Xbox One Has the BIGGEST EXCLUSIVES? ...

attributes.title: Mass Effect Andromeda OUR FAULT?
attributes.caption: Aug 23, 2017
attributes.description: Good news! Mass Effect may not be dead forever. Bad news! EA blames gamers for being too darn harsh on the game's flaws. So it's our fault, really, that the game didn't do well.

attributes.title: THE END of Half-life
attributes.caption: Aug 25, 2017
attributes.description: We may never get another Half-life game, but now we know how it ends. Or, at least, the end as the writer envisions it. 10 years on, Marc Laidlaw has put out his version of the missing Half-life episode, and it's bittersweet.

attributes.title: Final Fantasy XV GETTING NAKED? Awesome!
attributes.caption: Aug 25, 2017
attributes.description: Final Fantasy XV is coming to PC and getting mod support too, which as far as we can tell is code for "chocobros getting naked." That's been a matter of concern for the developers, but that's not going to stop modders. After all, that's why mods really exist.
attributes.display_title: Final Fantasy XV GETTING NAKED? Awesome!

attributes.title: Half-Life 3 Levels LEAKED?
attributes.caption: Half-Life 2: Episode 3's ending might have been revealed this week, and now we've got even more fallout from the series -- this time in the form of some potentially leaked prototype levels for Half-Life 3. Plus, gamers are now review-bombing Dota 2 in pro
attributes.description: Half-Life 2: Episode 3's ending might have been revealed this week, and now we've got even more fallout from the series -- this time in the form of some potentially leaked prototype levels for Half-Life 3. Plus, gamers are now review-bombing Dota 2 in protest of the unfinished games... never change, gamers.

attributes.title: Mario + Rabbids: Is it Good?
attributes.caption: Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle is out this week, and now we've got reviews! Will this very weird crossover between Mario and some even weirder sort-rabbits be worth your time? Is it just an XCOM clone? How many selfies can you take? We dig into the review
attributes.description: Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle is out this week, and now we've got reviews! Will this very weird crossover between Mario and some even weirder sort-rabbits be worth your time? Is it just an XCOM clone? How many selfies can you take? We dig into the reviews to find out.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Has SECRET Voice Chat?
attributes.description: So you know how Nintendo is getting all kinds of flack for not having proper voice chat, and have decided to use the app instead? Yeah, it turns out that voice chat actually does work on the system. It's just secret, and only for LAN. That's... not convenient.
attributes.display_title: Nintendo Switch Has SECRET Voice Chat?

attributes.title: Fallout 4 Gets PAID MODS
attributes.description: They've tried it once, and now they're doing it all over again -- Bethesda's put paid mods back onto Steam, this time in the form of Creation Club. Did they fix all the problems from the first time around? The internet doesn't think so, and they're letting Bethesda know about it.

attributes.title: Sonic Mania Fans MAD About DRM
attributes.description: Sonic Mania took its sweet time getting on PC, and according to fans, that's because it was busy adding everyone's favorite feature -- DRM! Sega launched the game with DRM and always online requirements, and if history's told us anything, it's that PC gamers just LOVE that stuff... right?
attributes.display_title: Sonic Mania Fans MAD About DRM

attributes.title: Destiny 2 PC Aim Assist Controversy
attributes.description: Destiny 2's PC beta is being celebrated as a port done right... well, except for one problem. Apparently, Destiny 2 is incredibly generous with aim assist for controllers, and even allows players to spoof that aim assist for their mouse and keyboard setup as well. Now we've got an argument on our hands about keyboard versus controllers all over again.

attributes.title: Xbox One X Pre-Order Overblown?
attributes.description: Xbox One X is getting hyped as the most pre-ordered Xbox ever, but one analyst has a bit of a bone to pick with that sentiment. And according to him, pre-order numbers for the system may not be simply just overblown, but "bull****."

attributes.title: GameStop: Expensive Bundles "More Convenient"
attributes.description: When a Nintendo system is hard to find, you can count on retailers to get more available... in the form of over-priced bundles with other stuff you don't want. Now, GameStop is defending that practice, claiming that it's "more convenient" for you to spend more money on the system. Right...

attributes.title: Nintendo Loses Lawsuit!
attributes.description: Oops, looks like Nintendo just lost a lawsuit over one of their consoles. Now they owe $10 million dollars in damages because of waggling -- we always knew it'd lead to trouble.

attributes.title: Dev Called Out for STEALING Credit?
attributes.description: A longtime iD Software developer sort-of claimed he invented the concept of multiplayer only maps in a recent interview... now, a bunch of his former colleagues are accusing him of taking credit for the work of others. So we've got a good old-fashioned developer fight on our hands, and they're setting the record straight.
attributes.display_title: Dev Called Out for STEALING Credit?

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... Destiny 2
attributes.description: Destiny 2 is only days away from launch. If you've been curious about what's different in the sequel -- or how it plans to avoid being as contentious in the first game -- we've got a round-up of everything you might want to know before you grab it from the store.

attributes.title: Journalists Shouldn't SUCK at Games?
attributes.caption: Sept 5, 2017
attributes.description: A video has been making the rounds of a game journalist playing Cuphead and being... not so good at the game. Now it's reigniting the conversation about whether game journalists are worth listening to if they're not even good at games.

attributes.title: Destiny 2 PAY TO WIN Microtransactions?
attributes.caption: Sept 5, 2017
attributes.description: Destiny 2 servers are live and players who got early physical copies are diving in to find... performance boosting microtransactions? Don't freak out, but get your concerned look ready.

attributes.title: Destiny 2 PLAYER REVOLT
attributes.caption: Sept 7, 2017
attributes.description: It seems like only yesterday the biggest concern Destiny 2 had was microtransactions that provided potentially boosting in-game items. Now it's gotten so much worse. THEY CAME FOR OUR FASHION.

attributes.title: South Park: The Fractured But Whole RACE-BASED DIFFICULTY
attributes.caption: Sept 8, 2017
attributes.description: South Park is no stranger to brutal social commentary, but the new race-based difficulty slider in The Fractured But Whole has still come as a surprise to many gamers. Well, that plus the whole cis/transgender options and the rednecks who assault you if they don't like you because of it. On the bright side? The difficulty doesn't affect combat! It just affects... your whole life.
attributes.display_title: South Park: The Fractured But Whole RACE-BASED DIFFICULTY

attributes.title: NO CONSEQUENCE for CSGO Lotto?
attributes.caption: Sept 8, 2017
attributes.description: Remember the whole scandal a few months back when it turned out YouTubers promoting a CS:GO Lotto website turned out to own the website? That got them pulled in front of a judge and now the verdict is in.

attributes.title: Steam Gets BANNED by Mistake
attributes.caption: Sept 8, 2017
attributes.description: Steam has seen a country-wide ban in Malaysia after the country demanded the platform remove the new game, Fight of Gods, over religious sensitivity concerns. Just because Jesus can fight Buddha or whatever, apparently.

attributes.title: The New War on Pewdiepie Could Ruin Let's Plays?
attributes.caption: Sept 11, 2017
attributes.description: Over the weekend a video of Pewdiepie dropping the n-bomb casually while playing Battlegrounds, leading Firewatch developer Campo Santo to ban him from doing videos in their games, even DMCAing a previous video. That's riled up the conversation around let's plays, streams, and fair use... and not necessarily in gamers' favor.
attributes.display_title: The New War on Pewdiepie Could Ruin Let's Plays?

attributes.title: Destiny 2 PLUMMETS 58%! Is It FAILING?
attributes.caption: Sept 11, 2017
attributes.description: The first sales numbers are in for Destiny 2 and.... well, they're down. a lot. from Destiny 1. Is it time to panic about the whole thing? Not just yet. Let's dig into the numbers and how they really compare.

attributes.title: Windows 10 BREAKS PC Games?
attributes.caption: Sept 12, 2017
attributes.description: You remember that fancy Creators Update that was supposed to make PC gaming on Windows 10 even better? Turns out it... kinda broke a lot of game performance instead. Luckily, MICROSOFT thinks they've got it licked! So... all's well that ends well?

attributes.title: Call of Duty Goes... MODERN?
attributes.caption: Sept 13, 2017
attributes.description: This year is all about World War 2, but could Call of Duty be returning to its Modern Warfare/Black Ops era next year with Treyarch? Signs so far point to... likely! Especially thanks to this shiny new job posting for Treyarch.

attributes.title: What VIDEO GAMES Are Learning from CASINOS
attributes.caption: Sept 13, 2017
attributes.description: Are video games becoming casinos where the money goes in but never comes out? A new study looks at the techniques casinos use to keep customers spending... and all the ways video games are starting to mirror them.
attributes.display_title: What VIDEO GAMES Are Learning from CASINOS

attributes.title: Mario's Nipples DESTROY THE INTERNET?
attributes.caption: Sept 14, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo made a lot of announcements at their Direct, but a picture is worth a thousand words and we all saw the most important thing: Mario's nipples. As you might expect, the internet promptly broke.

attributes.title: Game Gets SECRET Crossplay!
attributes.caption: Gamers on both PS4 and Xbox One were shocked to find out over the weekend that Fortnite had suddenly become the first game to offer crossplay between Sony and Microsoft, but is it a fluke?

attributes.title: Super Mario 64 Online NEW DMCA EDITION
attributes.caption: Sept 20, 2017
attributes.description: Who wouldn't want to play Super Mario 64 Online with a few dozen friends? It sounds awesome! And it is! Or... was. A modder who added multiplayer to the Nintendo game has found his YouTube videos and Patreon under attack by Nintendo over his work.
attributes.display_title: Super Mario 64 Online NEW DMCA EDITION

attributes.title: Steam's WAR on Unfair Review Bombs
attributes.caption: Sept 20, 2017
attributes.description: Steam's had a rough time with angry gamers review bombing games on the platform. Sometimes it has to do with the game itself. Sometimes it's done to "send a message" to a developer, mafia style. And Valve's not taking it anymore.
attributes.display_title: Steam's WAR on Unfair Review Bombs

attributes.title: EA: Studio KILLER Strikes Again
attributes.caption: Sept 21, 2017
attributes.description: EA's been accused of destroying well-loved studios in the past. Now, another developer has stepped forward to accuse the studio of trying to do it to his studio too.

attributes.title: Game Review CORRUPTION Controversy
attributes.caption: Sept 22, 2017
attributes.description: A game review just reevaluated its score because of the game publisher, reigniting the debate over review scores and how much influence game publishers have in the process. Time to dig in!

attributes.title: Battleground THREATS Over Copycat
attributes.caption: Sept 23, 2017
attributes.description: Battlegrounds developer Bluehole is crying foul over another game copying it and threatening "further action" to stop the copy. Ironic? A bit, maybe, but it depends on the ins and outs of video game business politics.

attributes.title: Gamer Culture Too TOXIC?
attributes.description: Gamers constantly want more transparency from their favorite pastime, but one developer says that's basically impossible. Why? Because gamers are just too toxic for it.

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... SNES Classic
attributes.description: Nintendo's newest retro re-release is hitting stores this Friday, so we're here to give you everything you need to know before you go out and buy the SNES Classic Edition!
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go... SNES Classic

attributes.title: Video Game Voice Actor Strike OVER!
attributes.description: It looks like the video game voice actor's strike is over! Is everything completely worked out and will everybody live happily ever after? Well that might be stretching it a little bit, but hey, at least the union and publishers will work together again. For now.
attributes.display_title: Video Game Voice Actor Strike OVER!

attributes.title: Sony Not Interested in "PlayStation Switch"
attributes.description: If you were holding out hope for a PlayStation handheld console hybrid a la Switch... well, we've got some bad news for you. Sony's not really interested. And if you were hoping for another Vita, we've got double bad news...

attributes.title: Valve Removes Fake Games!
attributes.description: Valve dealt another harsh blow in the ongoing Steam problem of fake games -- taking down one developer and more than 200 fake games all in one fell swoop. That's got to be some kind of record.

attributes.title: Modders DEFEAT DMCA Takedown!
attributes.description: Score one for the little guys! A PS3 emulator team fought back against a DMCA by publisher Atlus over PS3 version of Persona 5, and... won? That's not how that story usually goes.

attributes.title: SNES Classic pulls off mask... it was an NES the whole time!
attributes.caption: Sept 29, 2017
attributes.description: Einhorn is Finkle. Finkle is Einhorn. Einhorn is a man! Oh, my god!The SNES Classic is here, and just in time for the revelation that it's all just a reskin of the exact same NES Classic hardware! WHICH IS... actually, that kind of makes sense.
attributes.display_title: SNES Classic pulls off mask... it was an NES the whole time!

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 BREAKDOWN: Everything You Should Know
attributes.caption: Sept 28, 2017
attributes.description: The Red Dead Redemption 2 trailer is here! Let's go through all the details it gives us about what we can expect from the game when it launches.
attributes.display_title: Red Dead Redemption 2 BREAKDOWN: Everything You Should Know

attributes.title: Bethesda Not Guided by Fan Feedback
attributes.caption: Sept 30, 2017
attributes.description: Bethesda has made it clear they won't change their plans just because fans are loud. And we're not talking about the Creator Club either, even though that's just expanded to Skyrim and got fans upset that they're now paying for mods that were free. It's more to do with, say, Elder Scrolls VI.
attributes.display_title: Bethesda Not Guided by Fan Feedback

attributes.title: Forza 7 is a RIPOFF?
attributes.caption: Oct 2, 2017
attributes.description: Forza Motorsport 7 is about to hit the streets (for those who aren't VIP, at least), and fans are crying foul that the game has been fundamentally changed to expect gamers to drop extra money on microtransactions, and VIP has been nerfed without warning.

attributes.title: PlayStation President STEPS DOWN
attributes.caption: Oct 3, 2017
attributes.description: PlayStation president Andrew House is tapping out after 20+ years with Sony. He released the PS4. It's doing well. Now he's looking for some other kind of challenge, so he'll just be a chairman for now, which we're pretty sure is just a job title for people who sit in big comfy lounges and collect big paychecks.

attributes.title: World War II SAVES Call of Duty!?
attributes.caption: Oct 4, 2017
attributes.description: Even a "failure" by Call of Duty standards can be the best-selling game of the year, but that doesn't mean Activision's happy about it. Fortunately, taking the game back to World War II seems to be bringing in a lot more interest from fans. You guys! This indie series might be saved!
attributes.display_title: World War II SAVES Call of Duty!?

attributes.title: Consoles Held Fallout Back CONFIRMED
attributes.caption: Oct 4, 2017
attributes.description: It's long been the philosophy of PC gamers that developing games for consoles means the PC versions are held back. One developer on Fallout: New Vegas has just confirmed that this fear is a reality. DUN DUN DUN

attributes.title: Why Game Developers Don't Communicate
attributes.caption: Oct 5, 2017
attributes.description: Hot on the heels of one developer calling gamers toxic, Overwatch boss Jeff Kaplan's taking on accusations that Overwatch developers ignore their community to talk about why developers REALLY don't communicate.

attributes.title: Middle-Earth: Shadow of War: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.caption: Oct 9, 2017
attributes.description: Shadow of War is out soon and now the reviews are finally here. What did critics think about it? Did they talk about its loot boxes? Are the loot boxes canon? Come find out what the reviews said.
attributes.display_title: Middle-Earth: Shadow of War: IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Shortage OVER?
attributes.caption: Oct 5, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo's had trouble keeping up with the demand fro the Switch in some regions, but those days may be over (right in time for the holiday/Mario demand to kick in!) with Switch doubling production numbers. That's a lot of consoles.

attributes.title: Telltale's Batman Uses REAL Dead Body... Oops?
attributes.caption: Oct 6, 2017
attributes.description: Telltale's Batman: The Enemy Within launched its second episode recently, only for players to discover that... well, there's a dead body in it. No seriously, it's a real one. How did something like that slip through the cracks at Telltale? That's what the internet wants to know.
attributes.display_title: Telltale's Batman Uses REAL Dead Body... Oops?

attributes.title: Destiny 2 Has No Endgame?
attributes.caption: Oct 6, 2017
attributes.description: Destiny 2's in the middle of some community debate right now about the title's end-game content. And Bungie sort of stoked the flames by sort of suggesting that the real end-game content players need is the friends they'll make along the way. Yeah, that didn't go over too well.

attributes.title: Battlefront 2 a PAY 2 WIN Nightmare?
attributes.caption: Oct 9, 2017
attributes.description: "But I was going to Tosche Station to pick up some lootboxes!"The beta is here for Star Wars Battlefront II, and gamers are feeling a disturbance in the force--the game's balance-changing microtransactions paint a pretty dire pay to win picture.

attributes.title: Microtransactions TOO SUCCESSFUL to Stop?
attributes.caption: Oct 10, 2017
attributes.description: A new study shows just how much money microtransactions and loot boxes in AAA games is bringing into the game industry, so... looks like they're here to stay for now.

attributes.title: Know Before You Go... The Evil Within 2
attributes.caption: Oct 11, 2017
attributes.description: The Evil Within 2 is the sequel to 2014's The Evil Within by Shinji Mikami, creator of the Resident Evil series. Not sure if it's up your alley? Here's everything you need to know about the game's features!
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go... The Evil Within 2

attributes.title: Fortnite Cheaters SUED!
attributes.description: Watch out, cheaters -- Epic is on the hunt for people spoiling the Fortnite: Battle Royale experience for others. In fact, they want to get cheaters so bad that they're hitting two cheaters with lawsuits. This isn't even the first time they've sued a cheater, either.

attributes.title: Loot Boxes AREN'T Gambling?
attributes.description: Gamers have been up in arms over loot boxes recently, to the point where some are calling for the ESRB to rate loot boxes as gambling. Well, the ESRB has weighed in on the matter, and they think loot boxes are just fine.

attributes.title: Hackers Use Pokémon Go as Flame Bait!
attributes.description: Apparently Russian hackers tried to use Pokemon Go to make Americans really mad at each other? Which isn't even the weirdest thing to happen in the game and, come on, it's not like Americans need much help getting pissed off at each other anyway. That's like... our thing, man.
attributes.display_title: Hackers Use Pokémon Go as Flame Bait!

attributes.title: EA DEFENDS Battlefront II Loot Boxes!
attributes.description: Players got riled up about loot boxes in Star Wars: Battlefront II earlier this week, and now DICE and EA have responded to the complaints. Will a blog post be enough to assuage players' pay-to-win fears? Does anyone actually know the correct pronunciation of assuage?
attributes.display_title: EA DEFENDS Battlefront II Loot Boxes!

attributes.title: Game Devs DENY Harassment
attributes.description: Both CD Projekt Red and Naughty Dog made statements over the weekend regarding some allegations -- for CD Projekt Red, it was about the way they treat their employees, and for Naughty Dog, it was over accusations of sexual harassment. Here's how each company handled their situation.

attributes.title: Loot Boxes REPORTED to Government
attributes.description: Loot boxes are the hot topic in gaming right now, and one country's government might be tackling them head on. It looks like one parliament member of the UK has submitted an inquiry about loot boxes to the Secretary of State for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport. Will the government step in?

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch GONE WILD
attributes.caption: Oct 17, 2017
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch is ready to go through its Miley Cyrus twerking phase to show everyone it's all grown up! BRING ON THE SEXY GAMES!

attributes.title: EA CLOSES VISCERAL! Star Wars 'Reworked' into Games As A Service
attributes.caption: Oct 17, 2017
attributes.description: Remember that cool Star Wars game Visceral has quietly been working on? The one headed up by Amy Hennig with some star industry talent working on it? We're due to hear great things about it any day now, right? Nope... it's now being totally reworked to include Games As A Service elements and Visceral getting shut down.
attributes.display_title: EA CLOSES VISCERAL! Star Wars 'Reworked' into Games As A Service

attributes.title: Steam is STILL a Mess
attributes.caption: Oct 19, 2017
attributes.description: Valve has been putting in overtime to address problems with fake games and asset flipping on Steam. Curators, ditching Greenlight for Direct, that kind of thing. Unfortunately for them, it's not working.

attributes.title: Activision's Manipulative Microtransaction Patent
attributes.caption: Oct 18, 2017
attributes.description: Activision has just received a patent for microtransactions based on player activity. Not worried yet? What if matchmaking pairs you with a player with awesome gear so you get trampled and want to buy the same gear? Now are you concerned?

attributes.title: Destiny 2 PC Primer
attributes.description: Destiny 2 finally hit PC, so here is a quick rundown of everything you should know about Destiny and what you should do first in Destiny 2!  Good luck, new Guardians!

attributes.title: EA Done With Singleplayer Games?
attributes.description: After the closure of Visceral Games and the restructuring of their untitled Star Wars game many developers have come out in support of Single Player games.  However, one former EA developer has said that for the foreseeable future, Single Player games are DEAD...to EA.

attributes.title: Destiny 2 UNFAIR PC Bans?
attributes.description: Destiny 2's PC version couldn't launch problem free, right? After loads of accusations that the game has been unfairly banning people for no reason, Bungie has responded to say that anyone who got banned was actually cheating all along -- oh, and not that many people were affected by it. That didn't sit too well with the folks who were banned.

attributes.title: Know Before You Go...  Assassin's Creed: Origins
attributes.description: Assassin's Creed has taken a 2 year break. The newest game, Origins, launches on October 27. How much has changed? What's it about? Will it have loot boxes? Here's everything you need to know?
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go...  Assassin's Creed: Origins

attributes.title: Know Before You Go...  Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus
attributes.description: Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus is an action/adventure shooter, set in an alternate timeline where Nazis won World War 2 and have taken over. It's the sequel to 2014's Wolfenstein: The New Order, which was a soft reboot to the venerable franchise. Here's everything you need to know before it releases on PC, Playstation 4 and Xbox One on Oct. 27th.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go...  Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus

attributes.title: Bethesda REVERSES Review Policy
attributes.description: Bethesda controversially swore off early video game reviews last year -- but now it looks like the company is changing its tune, thanks to early review copies for Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus. Were sales affected by the lack of early reviews? And are those Wolfenstein II reviews any good? Let's find out.

attributes.title: Super Mario Odyssey: Is it good?
attributes.description: Super Mario Odyssey finally lands tomorrow, which means it's time to find out whether or not the game is any good. This is normally the part where we tease you with some kind of tantalizing question but come on, you've probably already heard, right?
attributes.display_title: Super Mario Odyssey: Is it good?

attributes.title: Loot Boxes DONT Affect Sales?!
attributes.description: With so much anger going around about loot boxes, some gamers are hoping that taking a stand against them will have a visible impact on sales. But so far, one industry analyst says that's not the case at all. So get ready for lots more.

attributes.title: Switch Outpacing EVERYTHING!
attributes.description: Nintendo's riding a wave of Switch success, and thanks to their new financial report, it looks like it's a WAY bigger wave than anybody could have predicted, already in position to sell more than the Wii U in its first year alone. We now know the exact number of units the console has moved to date, and it looks like those recent rumors about increased production are true. Is the Switch poised to overtake all the other consoles on the market?

attributes.title: Assassin's Creed: Origins DRM Breaking PCs?
attributes.description: PC players haven't been too happy about DRM these days, and it looks like one of the biggest releases of the year got a double dose of it! Players are reporting that Assassin's Creed: Origins's DRM is hampering the game's performance on their machines... and yeah, they're not too happy about that.
attributes.display_title: Assassin's Creed: Origins DRM Breaking PCs?

attributes.title: Know Before You Go...  Call of Duty: WWII
attributes.description: Call of Duty: World War II arrives on PC, Xbox One, and PS4 this week. After taking things back to the basics, Sledgehammer Games is adding a lot of changes to just about every aspect of the game. Here's everything you need to know.
attributes.display_title: Know Before You Go...  Call of Duty: WWII

attributes.title: EA Strikes Back Against Critics
attributes.description: EA's been dealing with criticism on all sides lately, thanks to controversies over its Battlefront II loot box practices and its closure of Project Ragtag developer Visceral. Now that its earnings call season, EA is answering questions about both of those issues for its investors -- it's time to hear their side of the story.

attributes.title: PS4 Games TOO VIOLENT?
attributes.description: Online outrage strikes again! Sony treated gamers to a ton of trailers earlier this week thanks to their conference at Paris Games Week -- but not everyone was pleased with some of the more mature subject matter on display. PlayStation is now responding to those complaints directly.

attributes.title: Activision Files ANOTHER Microtransaction Patent
attributes.description: Activision has filed for yet another patent that focuses on how to get you to spend more money on microtransactions. This one has to do with eSports and video game playback systems.

attributes.title: Video Games Are "Eco-Terrorism"?
attributes.description: Politicians are mad at video games again! Some lawmakers don't like a new PC game that lets you blow up oil pipelines and claim that it supports "eco-terrorism."

attributes.title: Call of Duty Is BACK!
attributes.description: Is the Call of Duty franchise back on track with its newest game: Call of Duty: WWII?

attributes.title: Xbox One X Breakdown!
attributes.description: We've had hands on time with the Xbox One X this week, and we've broken down some pointers about the system -- how to get the most out of your HDR settings, what Xbox Enhanced really means, and how it stacks up against the PS4 Pro.

attributes.title: XBOX: Next-Gen? No-Gen? on PlayStation? ALL OF THE ABOVE?
attributes.caption: Will Xbox have next-gen hardware? Will it go streaming instead? Will games appear on non-Microsoft platforms like PlayStation? Maybe all of the above! Confusing, maybe, but Xbox sure is doing a lot of talking.
attributes.description: Will Xbox have next-gen hardware? Will it go streaming instead? Will games appear on non-Microsoft platforms like PlayStation? Maybe all of the above! Confusing, maybe, but Xbox sure is doing a lot of talking.
attributes.display_title: XBOX: Next-Gen? No-Gen? on PlayStation? ALL OF THE ABOVE?

attributes.title: Will Anthem Have LOOTBOXES?
attributes.description: Bioware's new game Anthem is the newest game to join the lootbox debate!

attributes.title: Developers RUSHING To Support Switch
attributes.description: With the huge success of Nintendo's Switch some 3rd party developers are scrambling to get their games on the console as quickly as possible!

attributes.title: Gamers LOVE Microtransactions!
attributes.caption: Hate microtransactions? Voting with your wallet? So is everyone else and it looks like they disagree with you. So... get ready for more!
attributes.description: Hate microtransactions? Voting with your wallet? So is everyone else and it looks like they disagree with you. So... get ready for more!

attributes.title: Call of Duty LAWSUIT
attributes.caption: Activision's being sued over Call of Duty by... Hummer, the auto brand.
attributes.description: Activision's being sued over Call of Duty by... Hummer, the auto brand.

attributes.title: Forget Annual Games! PAY ALL THE TIME!
attributes.caption: Why pay for a game once er year when you can pay ALL YEAR ROUND? EA knows what you want, and it may be that. All hail Games as a Service..........................
attributes.description: Why pay for a game once er year when you can pay ALL YEAR ROUND? EA knows what you want, and it may be that. All hail Games as a Service..........................

attributes.title: Black Friday BEST GAMING DEALS
attributes.caption: Black Friday is coming. Want to pick up some games and hardware on the cheap? Here are the best deals out so far.
attributes.description: Black Friday is coming. Want to pick up some games and hardware on the cheap? Here are the best deals out so far.

attributes.title: Nintendo Gets TOO CONFIDENT?
attributes.caption: Nintendo's doing pretty well with the Switch so far, now that they're sorting out their hardware availability problems. Good enough that they think they'll sell 30 MILLION consoles per year? How realistic is that?
attributes.description: Nintendo's doing pretty well with the Switch so far, now that they're sorting out their hardware availability problems. Good enough that they think they'll sell 30 MILLION consoles per year? How realistic is that?

attributes.title: Star Wars: Battlefront II: Does it Suck?
attributes.description: Star Wars: Battlefront II is the bane of loot box haters everywhere, but what does the actual game play like? Reviews are finally dropping for one of the most contentious games of 2017... which means we can finally find out if the game's any good.
attributes.display_title: Star Wars: Battlefront II: Does it Suck?

attributes.title: EA Drops Battlefront 2 Unlock Prices After Player Backlash!
attributes.description: Gamers took to Reddit this weekend after Battlefront 2's early access dropped to complain about the outrageous prices for character unlocks and after achieving the most downvoted commented in Reddit history, EA responded.
attributes.display_title: EA Drops Battlefront 2 Unlock Prices After Player Backlash!

attributes.title: Skyrim Multiplayer BLOCKED by Bethesda?
attributes.caption: Enterprising modders have been working tirelessly to bring multiplayer to Skyrim. Unfortunately, Bethesda's putting up roadblocks.
attributes.description: Enterprising modders have been working tirelessly to bring multiplayer to Skyrim. Unfortunately, Bethesda's putting up roadblocks.

attributes.title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 INVESTIGATED
attributes.caption: The saga of Star Wars: Battlefront II backlash continues, with a reddit AMA that goes about how you'd expect, an investigation into the game's microtransactions. Honestly, this could make a great crawl.
attributes.description: The saga of Star Wars: Battlefront II backlash continues, with a reddit AMA that goes about how you'd expect, an investigation into the game's microtransactions. Honestly, this could make a great crawl.

attributes.title: YouTube Calls Out Nintendo
attributes.caption: If someone's got to call out Nintendo for the need to communicate and work better with video content creators, it should definitely be someone who knows what they're talking about, right? Like... YouTube? Huh. I mean, I guess they do know a thing or two a
attributes.description: If someone's got to call out Nintendo for the need to communicate and work better with video content creators, it should definitely be someone who knows what they're talking about, right? Like... YouTube? Huh. I mean, I guess they do know a thing or two about needing better communication...

attributes.title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 PAY 2 WIN DEFEATED! Or Is It?
attributes.caption: EA has made a HUGE change to Star Wars Battlefront II by removing microtransactions... TEMPORARILY. Does this mean they'll be fixed going forward? Is the game worth buying now?

attributes.caption: It's time for more Black Friday deals! Want to know where to get the best prices on games, PC components, consoles, and more? Strap in. There are a lot of them.

attributes.title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 is a FLOP?
attributes.caption: Fans haven't been too happy with Star Wars Battlefront 2's microtransactions. Now that they're temporarily out, was that enough to save the game's opening weekend? Doesn't look like it.
attributes.description: Fans haven't been too happy with Star Wars Battlefront 2's microtransactions. Now that they're temporarily out, was that enough to save the game's opening weekend? Doesn't look like it.

attributes.title: Gamers Should Pay MORE MICROTRANSACTIONS!? and be happy about it?
attributes.caption: Fresh off EA temporarily removing microtransactions from Star Wars Battlefront 2, one analyst thinks gamers are not only overreacting, but should be happy to pay MORE in microtransactions because they're such a good deal.

attributes.title: Kickstarter $1 MILLION Embezzlement!?
attributes.caption: A Kickstarter game has been accused of embezzling more than $1 million to fund a totally different project. Meanwhile, the accused is firing back with allegations of sexual misconduct. This one's a wild ride.

attributes.caption: Overnight the Belgium Gaming Commission and a Hawaiian government official both spoke up on lootboxes, and their days may be numbered.
attributes.description: Overnight the Belgium Gaming Commission and a Hawaiian government official both spoke up on lootboxes, and their days may be numbered, with one rep calling Battlefront 2 a "Star Wars-themed online casino designed to lure kids into spending money.” DOOOOOOOOOOMED

attributes.title: A Quick History of GAMES AS A SERVICE
attributes.caption: There's been a lot of concern over microtransactions and games that keep charging players AFTER they've bought a game. It might seem like the practice is a new one, but it's been a long evolution to get to this point.
attributes.description: There's been a lot of concern over microtransactions and games that keep charging players AFTER they've bought a game. It might seem like the practice is a new one, but it's been a long evolution to get to this point.

attributes.title: Fornite Battle Royale CHEATER Goes To Court!
attributes.caption: Fortnite developer Epic Games is going after cheaters in its Fortnite: Battle Royale game. So much so, that the company is suing a 14-year-old who publicized the use of cheats... and his mom isn't happy about it.
attributes.description: Fortnite developer Epic Games is going after cheaters in its Fortnite: Battle Royale game. So much so, that the company is suing a 14-year-old who publicized the use of cheats... and his mom isn't happy about them going after her baby boy.

attributes.title: Destiny 2 SABOTAGES Players
attributes.caption: Destiny 2 players have discovered that the game steals XP to slow down progress, and Bungie's facing accusations that it's done to drive microtransaction sales.

attributes.title: Loot Boxes NEW HERO
attributes.caption: Governments and gambling regulators have turned an eye to video games and loot boxes. Now some insiders are trying to self-regulate to keep governments out of games.
attributes.description: Governments and gambling regulators have turned an eye to video games and loot boxes following increasing complaints from players. Once, the video game industry stepped in to regulate itself and keep governments out. Now some insiders are trying to self-regulate to keep governments out of games.

attributes.title: EA Loses $3 BILLION Over Star Wars Battlefront 2
attributes.caption: EA's having a tough time convincing people to buy Battlefront 2. Following the game's troubled launch, EA's value has dropped $3 billion. But they're still convinced they're on the right track.
attributes.description: EA's having a tough time convincing people to buy Battlefront 2. Following the game's troubled launch, EA's value has dropped $3 billion. But they're still convinced they're on the right track.

attributes.title: Loot Boxes ILLEGAL for Kids?!
attributes.description: Everyone hates loot boxes, but now we've got the most serious move against them yet -- because a couple of US lawmakers are gearing up to write an anti-loot box bill that would ban them for everyone under the age of 21. Does that mean sexy adults-only loot boxes are on the way? Probably not.

attributes.title: Portal: Disappointment Constructor
attributes.description: If you thought we couldn't get any worse than a card game around a famous Valve property -- you've thought wrong. The internet got all abuzz yesterday about a rumor that a new Portal game could be announced this week. It turns out they were totally right -- but in the worst way possible. Get ready for Portal: Disappointment Constructor!

attributes.title: Destiny 2 RIPS OFF Players
attributes.caption: Destiny 2's Curse of Osiris content has dropped and... locked players out of previously accessible game content unless they buy the expansion too...

attributes.title: Playstation SLAMS Games as a Service
attributes.description: It seems like everyone's going the route of Games as a Service these days. But it sounds like Sony is taking a major stand against it for their PlayStation studios. What did the company have to say at PSX about GAAS... we really need a better acronym for that.

attributes.title: All the Games Set for 2018! Best Year Ever?!
attributes.description: Now that PSX and The Game Awards are done and all the major announcements are out of the way, we finally have a better idea about the layout of 2018 and what major games are waiting for us. Could it be one of the most stacked years of games ever? Don't we say that EVERY YEAR?!

attributes.title: Star Citizen SUED BY CRYTEK!?
attributes.caption: Star Citizen is a behemoth of a crowdfunded game, and that's the kind of thing that puts a target on your back. Now, Crytek, the creators of CryEngine (you know, the ones who couldn't afford to pay their employees for months) are suing Cloud Imperium for.
attributes.description: Star Citizen is a behemoth of a crowdfunded game, and that's the kind of thing that puts a target on your back. Now, Crytek, the creators of CryEngine (you know, the ones who couldn't afford to pay their employees for months) are suing Cloud Imperium for... not using them enough, not paying them enough, and not talking about them enough.
